title: Junior Software Engineer
job_description:
CRIO (Clinical Research IO) is a health tech company helping pharma, biotech, research sites, and academic research centers streamline regulatory workflows with one system and a single source of clinical data capture. Our modules allow sites to capture data electronically in real-time, providing data managers and monitors with enhanced transparency, and enabling remote monitoring by sponsors and CROs.
CRIO’s eSource and CTMS system is a leading, modern, enterprise platform built for clinical research sites. Since CRIO’s launch in 2016, CRIO has established the leading brand position in eSource and has won close to 50% of the emerging class of enterprise-grade site networks, many of whom are backed by institutional investors such as VC, PE and corporations. CRIO has achieved the attached metrics, all with little to no serious outbound sales or marketing.

Software Engineer
We are looking for a Junior Software Engineer who is eager to learn and grow in their career while contributing to a meaningful cause. An ideal candidate will understand the basics of software development and will be an enthusiastic self-starter, excited to work with experienced team members who can provide mentorship. Our software engineers are passionate about coding, problem-solving, and collaborating on exciting projects that make a real difference in the health tech space.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with senior engineers and team members on various projects.
Assist in developing cloud-based SaaS products and features.
Contribute to the design, implementation, and testing of software components.
Participate in code reviews and learn best practices in software development.
Troubleshoot and debug applications as needed.

Skills
Familiarity with programming languages such as Java, JavaScript, or Python.
Understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and frameworks (React, Angular).
Experience with relational databases (like MySQL) is a plus.
Knowledge of containerization tools such as Docker is beneficial.

Other Skills/Experience
Strong desire to learn and adapt.
Good communication and teamwork skills.
Detail-oriented and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
A positive attitude and eagerness to contribute.
1-2 years Experience in Software Development
Experience with standard software development practices, with exposure to one or more tools such as Jira and/or Github
Bachelor’s Degree or comparable experience in computer science, engineering, or a related field required.

Nice to Have

Internship or project experience in software development.
Exposure to cloud platforms like Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Experience in healthcare or life sciences domains is a plus.
(Please note that we do not currently provide visa sponsorship for this position. Candidates must possess the legal right to work in the United States without the need for sponsorship.)

Locations
Fully remote.

At CRIO, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

The pay range for this role is:
80,000 - 100,000 USD per year(Remote (United States))

title: Software Engineer
job_description:
Who is Blueprint?
We are a technology solutions firm headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, with a strong presence across the United States. Unified by a shared passion for solving complicated problems, our people are our greatest asset. We use technology as a tool to bridge the gap between strategy and execution, powered by the knowledge, skills, and expertise of our teams, who all have unique perspectives and years of experience across multiple industries. We're bold, smart, agile, and fun.
What does Blueprint do?
Blueprint helps organizations unlock value from existing assets by leveraging cutting-edge technology to create additional revenue streams and new lines of business. We connect strategy, business solutions, products, and services to transform and grow companies.
Why Blueprint?
At Blueprint, we believe in the power of possibility and are passionate about bringing it to life. Whether you join our bustling product division, our multifaceted services team or you want to grow your career in human resources, your ability to make an impact is amplified when you join one of our teams. You'll focus on solving unique business problems while gaining hands-on experience with the world's best technology. We believe in unique perspectives and build teams of people with diverse skillsets and backgrounds. At Blueprint, you'll have the opportunity to work with multiple clients and teams, such as data science and product development, all while learning, growing, and developing new solutions. We guarantee you won't find a better place to work and thrive than at Blueprint.
In this role:
As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to high-impact, large-scale initiatives across device supply chain, manufacturing, fulfillment, and services. You'll work in a dynamic operations technology team focused on optimizing and modernizing systems through cloud-native solutions and intelligent automation. This role emphasizes hands-on engineering, API development, Azure integration, and live site support — all critical to ensuring efficiency, scalability, and resilience in complex device operations.
Responsibilities:
Design, develop, test, and maintain scalable systems and applications in a cloud environment.
Modify and optimize existing databases and API systems for performance and reliability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project scope, timelines, and deliverables.
Write detailed logical and physical database descriptions and guide others in implementation.
Review technical requirements and project requests to assess feasibility, time, and cost.
Build, deploy, and manage RESTful APIs using C# and Azure-native tools.
Support production systems with proactive monitoring, troubleshooting, and incident resolution.
Integrate AI services (e.g., Azure Cognitive Services, Azure OpenAI) to enhance system capabilities.
Contribute to live site engineering practices, including telemetry, alerting, and system reliability strategies.
Required Qualifications:
Experience: Minimum of 8–10 years of software engineering experience.
Cloud Expertise: Strong hands-on knowledge of Microsoft Azure services, including:
Azure App Services
Azure Functions
Azure Storage
Azure Key Vault
Azure DevOps
Programming Skills: Advanced proficiency in C#, with a proven track record of developing and maintaining RESTful APIs.
Database & API Design: Experience with logical and physical database design and modification.
Systems Knowledge: Solid understanding of computer hardware and software fundamentals.
Full SDLC Understanding: Knowledge of the entire software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering to deployment and maintenance.
Live Production Support: Demonstrated experience supporting live systems, including root cause analysis and performance tuning.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with development tools such as SQL and Visual Basic.
Familiarity with prompt engineering and integration of Azure AI services into enterprise applications.
Ability to work independently in fast-paced environments.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Mentoring capabilities to support junior engineers or team members.
Salary Range
Pay ranges vary based on multiple factors including, without limitation, skill sets, education, responsibilities, experience, and geographical market. The pay range for this position reflects geographic based ranges for Washington state: $120,000 to $130,000 USD/annually. The salary/wage and job title for this opening will be based on the selected candidate's qualifications and experience and may be outside this range.
Equal Opportunity Employer
Blueprint Technologies, LLC is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, orientation, veteran/military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital, or familial status, genetic information, citizenship, or any other status protected by law.
If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process, please reach out to: recruiting@bpcs.com
Blueprint believe in the importance of a healthy and happy team, which is why our comprehensive benefits package includes:
Medical, dental, and vision coverage
Flexible Spending Account
401k program
Competitive PTO offerings
Parental Leave
Opportunities for professional growth and development

Job Title: Backend Software Engineer
Job Overview:
This role offers the opportunity to drive a technical vision and make a significant impact on a new product from day one. If you are passionate about building high-quality software and leading teams to success, we encourage you to apply.
We are seeking skilled Backend Software Engineers to join our development team, working closely with our Lead Full Stack Software Engineer. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust, scalable, and secure backend services for a new web application. This role focuses on building efficient server-side logic, integrating with databases, and developing RESTful APIs to power our frontend experiences. You will collaborate with front-end engineers, DevOps, and other stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions that meet business and user needs.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain backend services and APIs using Flask or Django and Python.
Build and optimize database models, queries, and stored procedures using MS SQL (or similar RDBMS).
Collaborate with frontend engineers to ensure seamless integration of backend services with user-facing components.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code, adhering to best practices for security, scalability, and maintainability.
Implement automated unit and integration tests to ensure code quality and reliability.
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.
Optimize application performance, conduct load testing, and troubleshoot backend issues.
Contribute technical documentation for both internal and external stakeholders.
Work within Linux-based development environments and participate in deployment processes.
Stay up to date with emerging backend technologies and advocate for continuous improvement.

Requirements:
Must have Healthcare RCM Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2+ years of professional experience in backend web development.
Proficiency in Python and Flask or Django for backend application development.
Strong experience with RESTful API design and implementation.
Solid understanding of relational databases, preferably MS SQL, including schema design and query optimization.
Familiarity with Linux-based development and deployment environments.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Qualifications and Experience:
Experience with additional backend frameworks (e.g., FastAPI) or microservices architectures.
Knowledge of Healthcare and RCM operations.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and automated deployment practices.
Experience with performance monitoring and tuning backend systems.
Exposure to frontend technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.
Engineering degree preferred
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Ability to think strategically and solve complex problems.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Must be legally authorized to work in the USA. No Contractors, No C2C, No Visa Sponsorship.

Location & Hours:
Remote
Mon-Fri 8:00 AM to 4:30 PMCST
Flexible working hours may be required based on business

Join our growing team and help shape the user experience of a cutting-edge web application from the ground up. If you are passionate about frontend development and eager to work in a collaborative, innovative environment, we encourage you to apply.

title: Front End Software Engineer
job_description:
About Plenful
Plenful is a healthcare automation and AI technology platform that pairs automation alongside human task management to optimize the manual, administrative workflows that bog down healthcare today. We partner with innovative healthcare organizations to provide better operational outcomes, financial outcomes, and experiences for both patients and healthcare staff.

Our team is a strong blend of healthcare and technology experts with multiple exits under our belts. Our team comes from top companies such as Google, Shields Health Solutions, Goldman Sachs, and numerous enterprise startups. We’re patients too, and we’re passionate about advancing healthcare efficiency through software.

We are backed by exceptional healthcare and technology investors including Bessemer Venture Partners. Our HQ is in San Francisco and we are open to remote work. Learn more about us at Plenful.com.

Join our growing team!

About the role
We are hiring an exceptional Front End Software Engineer to play a key role in our team. At Plenful, we believe the Engineering-Product-Design (EPD) triangle is essential to our product’s success. As a Front End Software Engineer, you will have the opportunity to own critical features and drive engineering efforts as we scale our platform.

What you’ll do
Build features according to product requirements and designs
Conduct code reviews of other engineers’ work
Work cross-functionally with design and customer success to ensure work meets the needs of our customers and prospects
Write PRDs, design documents, and other proposals to share thought process with the team and drive the product forward.
What we’re looking for
3+ years of full-time B2B SaaS front end engineering experience
2+ years of professional experience in React and Typescript.
Strong communication skills and a passion for user-centered design.
Experience with Figma, Design Systems, Python, and modern API frameworks like FastAPI
Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field

Plenful perks
Great benefits include unlimited PTO, health insurance, meal stipend, health & wellness stipend, team offsites, 401K matching, and stock options
Join an all-star team with direct access to executive leadership
Opportunities to further develop and refine your partnership acumen by partnering with our seasoned leaders

title: Machine Learning Engineer
job_description:
Position Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Department: Data Engineering
Reports to: Manager of Data Engineering
Classification: Salary (Exempt)

COMPANY PROFILE
Fragrance.com is a worldwide leading beauty e-commerce company created to provide the public with access to the largest inventory of genuine, brand name fragrances, skincare, candles, aromatherapy and more.
JOB OVERVIEW
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work closely with the Manager of Data Engineering and cross-functional teams to acquire, clean, and analyze data, build and optimize machine learning models, and deploy them into production. You will play a crucial role in developing models that directly impact business outcomes.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Data Acquisition & Cleaning: Collect and preprocess large datasets, ensuring data quality and transforming raw data into usable formats for model training.
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Perform data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights that inform model development.
Feature Engineering: Identify and create relevant features from raw data to enhance model accuracy and performance.
Model Building & Selection: Develop, select, and fine-tune machine learning models using the most appropriate algorithms for various business applications.
Model Validation & Deployment: Validate models through rigorous testing, ensuring they meet performance standards, and deploy them into production environments.
SKILL/EXPERIENCE/PROFICIENCY REQUIREMENTS
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python or R, with experience in machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and data manipulation, data visualization (Matplotlib or Seaborn) and Structured Query Language (SQL).
Knowledge of Machine Learning Algorithms: Strong understanding of supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning techniques.
Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities, effective communication skills, and a collaborative mindset. Eagerness to learn and stay current with new technologies and methods.
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
Relevant coursework or certifications in machine learning is a plus.
PRFERRED, NOT REQUIRED
Proficiency in ML Ops tools (e.g., MLflow or Anaconda)
Experience with Snowflake or Databricks
LIMITATIONS AND DISCLAIMER
The above job description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed; it is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for the position.
FRAGRANCE.COM BENEFITS:
Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
PTO and Paid holidays
Paid Sick & Safe Leave
Paid Prenatal Leave
Short Term Disability
Life Insurance
Accident & Critical Illness
Flexible Spending Account
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan and match
Employee Discounts
**This is a direct hire. No agencies or recruiters please**
Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.


Fragrance.com is firmly committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity. Fragrance.com offers employment opportunities without regard to race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, disability, U.S. military and or other prohibited bases of discrimination, both state and local. All aspects of the employment relationship (including recruiting, hiring, training, working conditions, compensation, promotion, discipline, and termination) are subject to this policy.

title: Front End Web Developer – WordPress/Elementor
job_description:
Company Overview
Voted #1 EHR by PC Mag, WRS Health delivers a fully integrated cloud based EMR and practice management solutions to its clients. We bring solutions to physicians by providing constant enhancement of our products and services including EHR, practice management, marketing, patient coordination and billing.
Job Purpose and Role
We are seeking a talented Front End Developer with expertise in WordPress and Elementor to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for updating and customizing our website by collaborating with marketing and ensuring that the site is optimized for both user experience and performance. You will work closely with other team members within a scrum framework, contributing to the overall development process and bridging the gap between design and technical implementation.
You’ll work on a mix of internal marketing sites, client projects, and ongoing site updates.

Collaborate with the marketing team to integrate engaging content into the website using WordPress and Elementor for both internal marketing and client websites.
Work closely with designers, content creators, and marketing teams to ensure websites meet business goals and brand standards.
Work within a multidisciplinary team, including back-end developers and web designers, to deliver cohesive and functional applications.
Ensure that the website design aligns with user experience requirements and is consistent with UX guidelines.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide technical recommendations for new projects
Document processes, coding practices, and custom development work to ensure knowledge transfer within the team.
Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies, continuously improving and updating skills to bring innovative solutions to the team.
Qualifications
Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a Front End Developer.
Proficient in WordPress development and customization.
Proficient with Elementor.
Strong skills in front-end development, including HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with a focus on delivering high-quality work.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with team members at all levels.
Knowledge of current SEO techniques and how to implement them within WordPress.
Familiarity with tools like Google PageSpeed Insights, GTmetrix, or Lighthouse for performance analysis and optimization.
Experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and Google Tag Manager configuration is a plus.

This is an Independent Contractor position.

title: Front-end Developer
job_description:
Company Overview
We are growing! SharpRank is an independent, data driven two-sided platform that leverages algorithms and statistical modeling to bring transparency to sports betting personalities at media outlets. As we enter the product development phase of our platform, we are adding talent to our development team to catapult us to the next level. SharpRank is the trusted household name for 3rd party rankings and enables the public access to content, data, cross sport functionality, games, and competition. Come join the Ranks!
Check out our latest feature on Jim Cramer’s the Street platform: https://twitter.com/BullMktFantasy/status/1352705018273673227?s=20
Description
SharpRank is looking for a Front-End Software Engineer to join our growing Engineering team and build out the next generation of our platform. The ideal candidate is a hands-on platform builder with significant experience in developing scalable data platforms. We are looking for someone with experience in front-end design, data visualization, business intelligence, and analytics. They must have strong, firsthand technical skills in a variety of object oriented and front-end technologies and the proven ability to fashion robust scalable solutions that can manage large data sets. They must be at ease working in an agile environment with little supervision. This person should embody a passion for continuous improvement, delivering a quality, robust product, and, most of all, sports!
The qualified candidate will lessons learned in his/her previous experience designing and developing software applications and pull it all together to take on a foundational role in a startup company with a bright future. He/She will work directly with the leadership team to gather requirements, generate mockups, and develop an application from conception to delivery. The key to success for the qualified candidate is an open channel of communication between the candidate and the leadership team. Have a question or an idea for improvement? We’re all ears.
Responsibilities
Design and develop the front-end UI in brand new software applications ranging from static web apps to mobile applications
Work directly with the leadership team to gather
Create mockups and documentation
Provide ongoing maintenance, support, and enhancements to existing products
Work alongside other engineers to elevate technology and consistently
best practices
Requirements/Skills
3+ years experience with JavaScript/TypeScript
3+ years experience with a front-end framework like Vue, React, Angular; React or Vue preferred
1+ years experience with Nuxt.js or Next.js preferred
3+ years experience with HTML/CSS/SASS
3+ years experience with the full software development lifecycle
1+ year in an agile development environment
Any experience with the following technologies is considered a plus: React Native, Microsoft Azure, .NET 6, CI/CD pipelines
Displays excellent communication skills
Experience consuming 3rd party RESTful APIs
Working knowledge of a source control system – git, Mercurial, TFS, etc.
Please inquire with resume and portfolio links to: info@sharprank.com

title: Front End Web Developer
job_description:
About us
Coalition is the world's first Active Insurance provider designed to help prevent digital risk before it strikes. Founded in 2017, Coalition combines comprehensive insurance coverage and innovative cybersecurity tools to help businesses manage and mitigate potential cyberattacks.
Opportunities to make an impact with bold thinking are real—and happening daily at Coalition.

About the role
Do you love crafting code while keeping an eye on the numbers? If so, we're looking for a Web Developer to own all of our web properties on the Marketing Team. This is a critical role in our organization as it enables us to reach thousands of potential customers every day to help them learn about what we're doing to protect the cyber world from emerging threats. You'll be working collectively across our organization to better identify our impact on customers.
As a Web Developer, you will design, build and run our website-led growth experiments and measure the impact on metrics like revenue, customer growth, retention, or engagement. Collectively with Product, Design, and Engineering, you will build user-facing features, activation experiences, and many other areas to improve the overall website user experience.
We want you to grow both as a guide and a technologist so we'll provide mentorship from our marketing authorities & our engineers. You'll gain exposure to a wide range of technologies and approaches that are not limited to website development but will also give you a comprehensive grasp of the entire product.
Responsibilities
Design and implement highly receptive web-based user interface
Develop the latest user-facing features using React.js
Build reusable components and front-end libraries on Contentful
Work with the cross-functional teams to identify user cases and user needs
Collaborate with department administration and external agencies to build the technical roadmap
Enhance components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers
Collaborate with back-end and API developers to enhance the user experience
Write tests for new and existing features to improve overall test coverage
Architect and build the Next application framework so we can use custom as well as out of the box component on Contentful
Work on advancing standards and practices in the web development discipline
Act as a bridge between engineering, product and marketing administration and our delivery teams
Skills and Qualifications
3-5 years of experience as a full stack web developer with overall programming experience
Experience with React is required (bonus points for Next.js)
Enterprise level CMS experience required, bonus point for Contentful
Expertise in developing web applications with React, Hooks, and TypeScript
Knowledge of the server-side JavaScript ecosystem (Node.js)
Experienced in writing unit tests using JEST framework or any similar framework
Familiar with modern front-end build pipelines and tools like Webpack, NPM etc.
Experience with GraphQL, CSS and familiar with preprocessors
Expertise with browser APIs and enhancing front end performance
Need to practice modern software development techniques such as continuous integration & distributed version control
Basic knowledge of statistics to measure impact on key metrics (revenue, customer growth, retention, and engagement)
Have strong teamwork experience, open to diverse opinions, and can document reasons for the technical judgements
Compensation
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The US base salary for this position ranges from $85,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $120,000/year in our highest geographic market. Consistent with applicable laws, an employee's pay within this range is based on a number of factors, which include but are not limited to relevant education, skills, job-related knowledge, qualifications, work experience, credentials, and/or geographic location. Your recruiter can share more on target salary for your location during the interview process. Coalition, Inc. reserves the right to modify this range as needed.
Perks
100% medical, dental and vision coverage
Flexible PTO policy
Annual home office stipend and WeWork access
Mental & physical health wellness programs (One Medical, Headspace, Wellhub, and more)!
Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
Why Coalition?
Work at Coalition is centered on the joint mission to Protect the Unprotected. We have built a remote-first, highly inclusive culture that welcomes people from diverse backgrounds. We trust each other to take responsibility, share ownership of outcomes, and put in the work together to protect businesses from digital risk. Coalition's exceptional growth stems from its ability to address real-world problems for organizations of all sizes while remaining true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, authenticity, and inclusion.
We're always looking for collaborative, inquisitive individuals to join #OurCoalition.
Visit our Newsroom >
Privacy Notice
Coalition is committed to protecting your privacy and handling your personal information responsibly. We collect, use, and store personal information as necessary for the recruitment process and in compliance with applicable privacy laws and regulations in all regions where we operate. We want you to understand what personal information we collect, how we use it, and your rights regarding access, correction, and deletion of your data where applicable. Information submitted, collected, and processed as part of your application is subject to Coalition's Privacy Policy. For further details, please review our full Privacy Policy or contact us with any questions regarding how your information is handled.
Our Privacy Policy >
Anti-Discrimination Notice
Coalition is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals, without discrimination or harassment on the basis of any characteristic protected by applicable laws in each country where we operate. This commitment includes, but is not limited to, ensuring equal treatment in recruitment, selection, training, promotion, transfer, compensation, and all other aspects of employment. Coalition does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive workplace.
Accommodations
Coalition is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, including applicants and employees, in accordance with applicable laws and regulations in each country where we operate. Our policy is to support equal opportunity in the hiring process by considering qualified applicants regardless of disability or other protected characteristics, unless providing accommodation would impose an undue hardship or disproportionate burden. If you require accommodation to complete an application, interview, pre-employment testing, or participate in the selection process, please contact us at candidateaccommodations@coalitioninc.com. We also consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in line with applicable laws and regulations in each jurisdiction.
To all potential candidates: Coalition primarily does not use third-party recruiting services. Potential candidates will only be contacted by Coalition, Inc. during the recruitment process. You can always verify any opportunity on our official careers page http://www.coalitioninc.com/careers.
To all recruitment agencies: Coalition does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Do not forward resumes to our email alias, employees, or other physical or virtual organization locations. Coalition is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Full Stack Web Developer
job_description:
About Lucia Protocol
Lucia Protocol is at the forefront of AI-driven data infrastructure, building the future of decentralized ad attribution. We are redefining how brands, publishers, and communities leverage Web3 to accurately track, attribute, and reward digital actions. Our team is innovating where AI, blockchain, and decentralized ecosystems intersect to power transparent and efficient ad measurement solutions.
Role Overview
We’re seeking a Full Stack Web Developer who is a lateral thinker and a self-starter, ready to take ownership of end-to-end product development. You’ll collaborate closely with our product and design teams to craft seamless user experiences and contribute to the underlying infrastructure powering our platform.
Key Responsibilities
Develop and maintain responsive web applications using React
Collaborate with design and product teams to deliver high-quality UI/UX
Translate product requirements into scalable and maintainable front-end and back-end code
Participate in architectural discussions and contribute to technical decision-making
Support application development lifecycle, including testing, deployment, and CI/CD pipeline management
Debug and troubleshoot issues across the stack
Requirements
3+ years of professional experience with React with Node.js, and backend API development
Strong understanding of web application design, including user flows and interaction design
Experience with building and maintaining component libraries or design systems
Ability to work independently, think critically, and adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Nice to Have
Familiarity with PostgreSQL and relational database design
Knowledge of AWS services and infrastructure management
Experience implementing CI/CD pipelines
Additional Information:
The salary range for this position is $85k - $125k
BEFORE APPLYING:
We are currently in an exciting fundraising phase and expect to secure funding within the next month or two. During this period, compensation will be deferred. We understand the financial circumstances and will ensure that the time commitment remains reasonable. Our expectation is to have team members who can provide valuable contributions while supporting themselves until the fundraising is complete. Are you open to joining our dynamic team and being part of this thrilling journey as we grow and secure our future together? If so, by applying to this position, you understand and are willing to proceed with this arrangement if selected.
Note: Lucia Protocol is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability status.

React
UX/UI Design

8 hour shift

Job Title: Backend Software Engineer
Job Overview:
This role offers the opportunity to drive a technical vision and make a significant impact on a new product from day one. If you are passionate about building high-quality software and leading teams to success, we encourage you to apply.
We are seeking skilled Backend Software Engineers to join our development team, working closely with our Lead Full Stack Software Engineer. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust, scalable, and secure backend services for a new web application. This role focuses on building efficient server-side logic, integrating with databases, and developing RESTful APIs to power our frontend experiences. You will collaborate with front-end engineers, DevOps, and other stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions that meet business and user needs.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain backend services and APIs using Flask or Django and Python.
Build and optimize database models, queries, and stored procedures using MS SQL (or similar RDBMS).
Collaborate with frontend engineers to ensure seamless integration of backend services with user-facing components.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code, adhering to best practices for security, scalability, and maintainability.
Implement automated unit and integration tests to ensure code quality and reliability.
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.
Optimize application performance, conduct load testing, and troubleshoot backend issues.
Contribute technical documentation for both internal and external stakeholders.
Work within Linux-based development environments and participate in deployment processes.
Stay up to date with emerging backend technologies and advocate for continuous improvement.

Requirements:
Must have Healthcare RCM Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2+ years of professional experience in backend web development.
Proficiency in Python and Flask or Django for backend application development.
Strong experience with RESTful API design and implementation.
Solid understanding of relational databases, preferably MS SQL, including schema design and query optimization.
Familiarity with Linux-based development and deployment environments.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Qualifications and Experience:
Experience with additional backend frameworks (e.g., FastAPI) or microservices architectures.
Knowledge of Healthcare and RCM operations.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and automated deployment practices.
Experience with performance monitoring and tuning backend systems.
Exposure to frontend technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.
Engineering degree preferred
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Ability to think strategically and solve complex problems.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Must be legally authorized to work in the USA. No Contractors, No C2C, No Visa Sponsorship.

Location & Hours:
Remote
Mon-Fri 8:00 AM to 4:30 PMCST
Flexible working hours may be required based on business

Join our growing team and help shape the user experience of a cutting-edge web application from the ground up. If you are passionate about frontend development and eager to work in a collaborative, innovative environment, we encourage you to apply.

title: Software Engineer (Full Stack)
job_description:
Company Overview
GAR Associates, LLC is a real estate appraisal and consulting firm with over 63 years of experience with offices in both the Capital Region and Western parts of New York. Over the past 20 years, GAR has made significant investments in software engineering and applications related to the assessment and appraisal industry, both internal and public-facing. That investment includes building an experienced team of software engineers that are excited about using new technology to create state-of-the-art assets that continue to expand our business.
Summary
We are seeking a full-stack software engineer to join our team. In this role, you will work with a team of engineers to write code for both backend APIs and frontend user interfaces. You will implement web-based applications that are optimized for performance, scalability, testing, and supportability. We are looking for a candidate that has demonstrated a passion for learning new technology and working with a team toward a common goal.
Responsibilities
Design and develop scalable web applications using modern frameworks and technologies.
Implement RESTful APIs to facilitate seamless communication between front-end and back-end systems.
Set up and help maintain Azure cloud-resources including Kubernetes.
Maintain and optimize existing applications for performance and security.
Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality and adherence to best practices.
Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously improve development processes.
Requirements:
5+ years experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role in software engineering.
Strong proficiency in React and Python programming languages.
Experience creating CICD flows and with Kubernetes in the Cloud
Experience in the following areas is a plus:
Cloud infrastructure (Azure or AWS)
Cloud deployment with Docker containers
Cloudflare / DNS
Restful API, FastAPI
Go Language
ESRI or Google Mapping
Logging/Telemetry
Unit testing
Security standards such as OAuth
Agile team process
If you're ready to take your career to the next level with an innovative team dedicated to excellence in software development, we invite you to apply today at GAR Associates. Your next big opportunity awaits!
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $100,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work Location: Remote

title: Software Engineer
job_description:
Are you a Software Engineer looking to join one of the top companies in the Banking Industry?
Are you looking to further your career and grow?
Do you have experience in systems analysis/application development?
If you answered yes to those three questions, then apply today!
Acara Solutions seeks highly qualified candidates to work Remotely with our client in Buffalo, NY. Interested?
Here's what you'd do:
Provides designs, specifies information systems solutions, and highly technical direction in developing new or existing applications to solve basic to complex problems or enhancements.
Serves as a principal application designer for major modifications, effectively using analytical and technical skills and available technology and tools to evaluate client requirements and processes.
Provides technologically sound solutions.
Complete day-to-day support activities and special projects.
Often directs and monitors the activities of less experienced personnel.
Complete and oversee basic to complex systems analysis, design, and development.
Play a key role as an individual contributor on complex projects.
Maintain an excellent functional understanding of the supported application(s).
Direct and monitor less experienced resources and coordinate development tasks on small to large scope projects.
Prepare and manage the technical component of project plans.
Participate with other Development, Operations, and Technology staff in the overall direction of systems development, from technical analysis to user acceptance testing.
Prepare and review test data and execute detailed test plans.
Complete any needed debugging.
Evaluate complex interrelationships and effects among programs, interfacing applications, and platforms.
Provide highly analytical consulting and leadership in identifying and implementing new uses of information technologies to assist business units in meeting strategic objectives.
Prepare thorough, precise technical and functional specifications and update systems documentation.
Prepare charts, tables, and diagrams to assist in analyzing problems.
Review documentation prepared by less experienced staff.
Prepare and review assessments that include required tasks, estimated time frames, and effort for any project of any scope.
Maintain efficient operation and effectiveness of supported applications.
Recommend new technology, policies, or processes to benefit the organization and improve deficiencies.
Lead or participate in technical evaluations of vendor software.
Follow and promote the use of development standards and procedures.
Maintain a good understanding of the supported business and its functions, processes, operations, and strategic direction.
Assist in developing expense and capital budgets.
Understand and adhere to the Company's risk and regulatory standards, policies, and controls by the Company's Risk Appetite.
Identify risk-related issues needing escalation to management.
Promote an environment that supports diversity and reflects the client brand.
Maintain client internal control standards, including timely implementation of internal and external audit points and any issues raised by external regulators as applicable.
Complete related duties or projects as needed, including leading in due diligence, cost/benefit analysis, or business study activities.
The position works under the supervision of the Technology Team Lead.
The job holder is competent to work independently on all high-level systems analysis and technical phases of development.
The position is capable of managing the activities of others on a project basis for small to considerable scope efforts and may lead project activities.
The job holder monitors staff performance on assigned projects relative to their overall abilities and effectiveness in completing projects within schedules.
The position interacts with senior management, other technology personnel, clients, and vendors.
The job holder provides backup to higher management as needed and is called to serve as a technical representative on committees and ad-hoc projects.
Looking for an experienced Salesforce Software Engineer with a solid background in developing Apex Code, Lightning Web Components, Flow, Validation Rules, Approval Processes, and a proven track record of delivering complex Salesforce solutions while delivering quality code.

Here's what you'll get:
Pay: $44.99 - $74.98 /hr.
Hours: 40 hrs./Week.
Length: Temp (6 months).

Sound like a good fit?
APPLY TODAY

About Acara Solutions
Acara is a premier recruiting and workforce solutions provider-we help companies compete for talent. With a legacy of experience in various industries worldwide, we partner with clients, listen to their needs, and customize visionary talent solutions that drive desired business outcomes. We leverage decades of experience to deliver contingent staffing, direct placement, executive search, and workforce services worldwide.

Required Skills / Qualifications:
High School Diploma or GED.
Minimum 5 years of experience in systems analysis/application development.
Minimum 7 years of experience in application development software and hardware platforms.
Minimum 7 years of experience in operating computers and pertinent project management, word processing, and spreadsheet software.
Minimum 7 years of experience in working on multiple projects of a complex nature.
Minimum 7 years of experience in presenting to the target audience.
Minimum 7 years of experience in coordinating between Applications and business units.
Minimum 7 years of experience in recommending and implementing systems solutions.
Minimum 7 years of experience in driving project milestones and delivery dates.
Minimum 7 years of experience in Salesforce Admin, LWC, APEX, Flows, and Triggers.
Minimum 7 years of experience in designing functional and technical features/functionality and presenting a leadership solution.
Minimum 7 years of experience in creating fields, writing LWC, APEX, and creating unit tests.

Preferred Skills / Qualifications:
Associate Degree.
Excellent problem-solving skills to assist in issue resolution.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
Good organizational and time management skills.
Detail-oriented.
Good lateral thinking skills.
Good understanding of the client application framework.
Subject matter expert in business with knowledge or experience utilizing the application/system being supported.
Advanced understanding of applications supported with a sound knowledge of interfacing/integrated applications.
Ability to work in a team environment as well as autonomously.
Ability to multitask for various components of complex projects.
Action-oriented.
Pro-active.
Advanced knowledge and focus on the system to work on projects outside normal business-as-usual (BAU).
Familiar with VS Code and GitLab.
Salesforce Certifications.
NCino Application experience.
NCino Banking.
Knowledge of Jira / Confluence, Agile / Scrum.
Salesforce Declarative (Fields, Approval Processes, Layouts).
Salesforce Dev (Apex, LWC, Flow).
Object Oriented Programming.

Additional Information:
Upon offer of employment, the individual will be subject to a background check and a drug screen.
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

Aleron companies (Acara Solutions, Aleron Shared Resources, Broadleaf Results, Lume Strategies, TalentRise, Viaduct) are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Race/Color/Gender/Religion/National Origin/Disability/Veteran.

Applicants for this position must be legally authorized to work in the United States. This position does not meet the employment requirements for individuals with F-1 OPT STEM work authorization status.

title: Mobile App Developer (Remote)
job_description:
About Ameriprise Financial
At Ameriprise Financial, we help people feel confident about their financial future. With more than 125 years of history, we're committed to upholding a culture of integrity, collaboration, and innovation. Our team of professionals is passionate about delivering excellent digital experiences that support our clients and advisors nationwide.
Position Overview
We are seeking a talented and driven Mobile App Developer to join our remote development team. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain high-quality mobile applications that enhance the user experience for our clients and financial advisors. You will work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment that encourages innovation and continuous improvement.
Key Responsibilities
Design and develop scalable, secure, and high-performing mobile applications for iOS and Android platforms.
Collaborate with UI/UX designers, backend developers, and product teams to deliver seamless user experiences.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and debugging to ensure software quality.
Stay current with emerging mobile technologies and development best practices.
Ensure applications comply with security and privacy standards.
Qualifications
Required:
3+ years of experience in mobile app development (iOS, Android, or cross-platform such as React Native or Flutter).
Proficiency in mobile frameworks and tools such as Swift, Kotlin, Java, Objective-C, React Native, or Flutter.
Experience working with RESTful APIs, JSON, and mobile architecture patterns (MVVM, MVC, etc.).
Understanding of the full mobile development lifecycle.
Ability to work independently and as part of a remote team.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
Must have the legal right to work in the United States.
Preferred:
Experience in the financial services industry.
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies.
Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools (CI/CD, Git, etc.).
Compensation & Benefits
Salary Range: $115,000 $130,000 annually (commensurate with experience).
Benefits Include:
401(k) with company match
Health insurance
Dental and vision insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off and holidays
Opportunities for growth and professional development
Application Process
Due to a high volume of applications, we kindly ask that interested candidates submit their complete application as soon as possible to be considered. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted for interviews.
Note: This position is open to U.S. applicants only. You must have the right to work in the United States.

title: Senior Mobile App Developer
job_description:
Job Title: Senior Mobile App Developer
Location: Remote
Experience Required: Minimum 4 years
Notice Period: Immediate to 15 Days

Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Mobile App Developer with
expertise in Kotlin, React Native, and iOS development. The ideal candidate will have
experience with cross-platform development and third-party integrations, enabling
seamless functionality across devices and platforms. This role requires a creative
problem-solver who can collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to deliver
high-quality solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
 Design, develop, and maintain mobile applications using Kotlin and React Native.
 Build and optimize iOS applications, ensuring smooth performance and an
intuitive user experience.
 Integrate third-party tools, APIs, and libraries to enhance app functionality and
performance.
 Work on cross-platform development to ensure applications are compatible with
both iOS and Android platforms.
 Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other developers to
implement new features and refine existing ones.
 Conduct code reviews and provide mentorship to junior developers to uphold
coding standards and best practices.
 Debug and resolve technical issues to ensure reliable and scalable solutions.
 Stay updated with emerging trends and technologies in mobile app development.
 Create technical documentation for applications to facilitate future maintenance
and updates.
Qualifications:
 Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
 Minimum of 4 years of experience in mobile app development.
 Proficiency in Kotlin, React Native, and iOS development frameworks.
 Strong experience in cross-platform development and third-party integrations.
 Solid understanding of the mobile app development life cycle, from concept to

title: Backend Software Engineer
job_description:
Do you want to be a part of a high-performance team? Are you passionate about the quality of software development and want to be a part of the strategy of world-class mobile applications? Then you belong with us!
We are seeking a Back End Software Engineer to join our team to build improvements for our customer experience in a fast, accessible, and intuitive way. You will partner with our client’s Product and Design teams on application design, user experience, developer workflows, deployment strategies, and testing of the back-end and processing for native mobile applications.
What You’ll Do:
Strong agile software development experienced
Be disciplined with designing and implementing unit tests, continuous integration and continuous delivery to production, source code repositories and build systems for web, web services, database, and mobile applications
Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from web service interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between
Ability to build scalable solutions and lead the implementation of that system by their team
Established track record of delivering complex software solutions
Problem-solving skills and the abilities to analyze quantitatively, scope technical requirements and effectively prioritize program deliverables
Demonstrate honesty, responsibility, integrity, and fulfillment of commitments
Technical innovator and thought leader, with ability to demonstrate and inspire continuous learning, experimentation, and data and metrics-driven decision making
What You’ll Bring:
Experienced coder in Go, Ruby, Python or similar with over 6 years experience developing applications and services in that language
Technical Experience includes building and deploying SaaS applications at scale using with data storage engines (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, AWS Dynamo, etc.)
Designed REST-based APIs for a complicated system
Demonstrated expertise securing an application at all levels from data at rest through the public interface
Experience delivering solutions on AWS, Google Cloud or Azure. Google Cloud preferred
Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
A minimum of 6 years of software development experience

About Nimble Gravity
Nimble Gravity is a team of outdoor enthusiasts, adrenaline seekers, and experienced growth hackers. We love solving hard problems and believe the right data can transform and propel growth for any organization.
Nimble Gravity Product Engineering collaborates closely with the Included Health Product Management and Design teams to scale and strengthen their Web and Android experiences. Included Health’s powerful healthcare navigation app includes personalized Provider matching, 24/7 Telemedicine+, Expert opinions on diagnoses and treatment plans, and medical claims advocacy.

title: Web Designer
job_description:
We’re a results-driven marketing agency seeking a reliable and creative Freelance Web Designer for ongoing work. Our clients are mostly in the service industry (think contractors, real estate professionals, and local businesses), and we need clean, high-converting websites that make them shine.
This is a remote, flexible role with a steady stream of projects—ranging from full site builds to landing pages and occasional website tweaks or redesigns. If you love crafting sleek designs with marketing performance in mind, this could be a great long-term fit.
What You’ll Do:
Design and build responsive websites and landing pages optimized for conversions
Create polished mockups and prototypes before development (Figma, XD, or similar)
Collaborate with our marketing and development teams to ensure strategic goals are reflected in the design
Implement or update pages using drag-and-drop builders (e.g., Elementor, Webflow, or similar)
Occasionally design supporting assets like banners, icons, or pop-ups
Maintain consistency with brand guidelines and UX best practices
What We’re Looking For:
Strong portfolio of web design projects (especially marketing or service-industry sites)
Proficiency with tools like Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar
Experience with WordPress (Elementor preferred), Webflow, or other no-code/low-code platforms
A balance of creativity and practicality—you know how to make things look great and convert
Understanding of mobile-first design, basic SEO principles, and user experience flows
Bonus: Familiarity with Google Analytics, CRO principles, or basic HTML/CSS
Perks:
Flexible remote work
Consistent freelance work with potential for a larger role
Autonomy to own your projects and contribute ideas
Low-ego team that values both creativity and results
How to Apply:
Send a brief intro, your portfolio (web-specific work preferred), and any relevant tools or platforms you’re most comfortable using. Include your typical turnaround time and availability for new projects.

title: Web Designer
job_description:
We’re a results-driven marketing agency seeking a reliable and creative Freelance Web Designer for ongoing work. Our clients are mostly in the service industry (think contractors, real estate professionals, and local businesses), and we need clean, high-converting websites that make them shine.
This is a remote, flexible role with a steady stream of projects—ranging from full site builds to landing pages and occasional website tweaks or redesigns. If you love crafting sleek designs with marketing performance in mind, this could be a great long-term fit.
What You’ll Do:
Design and build responsive websites and landing pages optimized for conversions
Create polished mockups and prototypes before development (Figma, XD, or similar)
Collaborate with our marketing and development teams to ensure strategic goals are reflected in the design
Implement or update pages using drag-and-drop builders (e.g., Elementor, Webflow, or similar)
Occasionally design supporting assets like banners, icons, or pop-ups
Maintain consistency with brand guidelines and UX best practices
What We’re Looking For:
Strong portfolio of web design projects (especially marketing or service-industry sites)
Proficiency with tools like Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar
Experience with WordPress (Elementor preferred), Webflow, or other no-code/low-code platforms
A balance of creativity and practicality—you know how to make things look great and convert
Understanding of mobile-first design, basic SEO principles, and user experience flows
Bonus: Familiarity with Google Analytics, CRO principles, or basic HTML/CSS
Perks:
Flexible remote work
Consistent freelance work with potential for a larger role
Autonomy to own your projects and contribute ideas
Low-ego team that values both creativity and results
How to Apply:
Send a brief intro, your portfolio (web-specific work preferred), and any relevant tools or platforms you’re most comfortable using. Include your typical turnaround time and availability for new projects.
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $15.00 - $35.00 per hour
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Schedule:
Choose your own hours
Work Location: Remote

title: WordPress Developer
job_description:
Company Overview
Killerspots Agency is a contagiously creative digital marketing and media agency that has been leading brands worldwide since 1999. With a full-service approach, we provide everything from web development and graphic design to inbound marketing strategies—all under one roof. Our team culture is built around strategy, measurable results, and exceptional customer service.
Summary
We are looking for a talented and creative Remote WordPress Web Designer to join our team at Killerspots Agency. This is a 100% remote position—you can work from anywhere. In this role, you’ll be responsible for building and maintaining high-impact WordPress websites that not only look stunning but also drive meaningful results for our clients. You’ll work in a collaborative environment where your skills will help shape digital experiences for brands across the country.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain responsive WordPress websites that meet client goals and specifications.
Professionally collaborate with both clients and team members to deliver seamless user experiences, provide updates, gather feedback, and ensure expectations are exceeded—all in a remote work setting.
Implement custom themes and plugins to extend website functionality.
Optimize websites for performance, speed, accessibility, and SEO best practices.
Troubleshoot and resolve website issues quickly and efficiently.
Stay current with the latest industry trends, WordPress updates, and emerging technologies.
Translate client needs and ideas into visually appealing, conversion-focused web pages.
Requirements
To be considered, you MUST submit a portfolio link of your past work via an Indeed message, your resume or hr@killerspots.com.
Proven experience as a WordPress Designer/Developer, with a strong portfolio of live sites.
Advanced knowledge of front-end technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP.
Experience developing custom WordPress themes and plugins.
Familiarity with RESTful APIs and scalable system architecture.
Understanding of UI/UX principles and best practices for creating engaging digital experiences.
Knowledge of plugins
Strong communication skills with the ability to collaborate professionally and effectively with both clients and internal teams.
Strong troubleshooting skills and keen attention to detail.
Ability to thrive and collaborate in a fully remote, fast-paced team environment.
Reliable internet connection and remote work setup.
Bonus: Experience with SEO optimization, WooCommerce, or marketing automation integrations.
Bonus: Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.
If you’re ready to unleash your creativity and level up your career with a team that values innovation and results—all from the comfort of your own workspace—we want to hear from you! Apply today to join Killerspots Agency—where your talent helps brands make a lasting impact, no matter where you are.
NOTES:
To be considered, you MUST submit a portfolio link of your past work.
Background and references are a must.
Absolutley NO PHONE calls please.

title: Front End Web Developer – WordPress/Elementor
job_description:
Company Overview
Voted #1 EHR by PC Mag, WRS Health delivers a fully integrated cloud based EMR and practice management solutions to its clients. We bring solutions to physicians by providing constant enhancement of our products and services including EHR, practice management, marketing, patient coordination and billing.
Job Purpose and Role
We are seeking a talented Front End Developer with expertise in WordPress and Elementor to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for updating and customizing our website by collaborating with marketing and ensuring that the site is optimized for both user experience and performance. You will work closely with other team members within a scrum framework, contributing to the overall development process and bridging the gap between design and technical implementation.
You’ll work on a mix of internal marketing sites, client projects, and ongoing site updates.
Job Duties and Responsibilities
Collaborate with the marketing team to integrate engaging content into the website using WordPress and Elementor for both internal marketing and client websites.
Work closely with designers, content creators, and marketing teams to ensure websites meet business goals and brand standards.
Work within a multidisciplinary team, including back-end developers and web designers, to deliver cohesive and functional applications.
Ensure that the website design aligns with user experience requirements and is consistent with UX guidelines.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide technical recommendations for new projects
Document processes, coding practices, and custom development work to ensure knowledge transfer within the team.
Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies, continuously improving and updating skills to bring innovative solutions to the team.
Qualifications
Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a Front End Developer.
Proficient in WordPress development and customization.
Proficient with Elementor.
Strong skills in front-end development, including HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with a focus on delivering high-quality work.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with team members at all levels.
Knowledge of current SEO techniques and how to implement them within WordPress.
Familiarity with tools like Google PageSpeed Insights, GTmetrix, or Lighthouse for performance analysis and optimization.
Experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and Google Tag Manager configuration is a plus.

This is an Independent Contractor position.
Job Type: Full-time - Remote
Hours: 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM EST or 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM EST
This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure proper operations of the department.

title: Web Developer
job_description:
Job Title: Web Developer
Location: Remote/Hybrid (Berkeley, CA)
Employment Type: Full-Time (40 hours/week, Monday–Friday)
Duration: 3–4 Month Contract (with potential extension based on funding and business needs)
Pay Rate: $60/hour + Benefits
Client: Bay Systems Consulting, in support of Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory (Berkeley Lab)
Position Overview:
Bay Systems Consulting is seeking a Web Developer to support the Human Resources Division at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory. This role is critical in rebuilding, modernizing, and maintaining the HR website infrastructure to improve user experience, platform alignment, content accuracy, and long-term sustainability. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated expertise in WordPress, website planning, cybersecurity-aware design, and collaboration with non-technical stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities:
Website Rebuilding & Maintenance
Lead the rebuilding of the HR website to enhance functionality, usability, and accessibility
Establish and implement a sustainable website maintenance plan
Remove outdated content and prevent its visibility via search engines
Conduct thorough testing and troubleshooting across browsers and platforms
Project Planning & Collaboration
Work closely with HR Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to translate content and functional needs into user-friendly web experiences
Develop a structured plan and production schedule for connecting and consolidating content across WordPress and Google Sites
Recommend platform assignments based on audience type: Public (WordPress), Lab Community, and Internal HR use
Create prototypes and seek SME feedback before full implementation, ensuring alignment with UX/UI and accessibility best practices
Provide guidance and consultation to HR SMEs throughout development and maintenance phases
Content Management & Platform Alignment
Organize and manage HR content tailored for both public-facing and internal audiences
Modify existing pages, content access levels, and update site structures as needed
Ensure all web content is accurate, current, and accessible
Compliance, Design & Visual Identity
Align all HR web pages with Berkeley Lab’s visual standards, branding guidelines, and cybersecurity policies
Assist with building HR web templates consistent with Lab-approved graphics
Leverage visual assets for web presentations (e.g., PowerPoint, Google Slides)
Provide regular updates to HR management regarding IT requirements and web compliance changes
Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Proven experience developing and maintaining websites within cybersecurity-constrained environments
Proficiency with WordPress and Google Sites
Strong grasp of UX/UI principles, accessibility standards, and content architecture
Ability to manage full development cycles including conceptualization, design, testing, and rollout
Comfortable working with and guiding non-technical stakeholders
Familiarity with compliance requirements in a research or government-affiliated environment
Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to meet competing deadlines
General graphic design proficiency for banners, templates, and basic web visuals
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Education & Experience Requirements:
3-7 years of experience in professional web development
Demonstrated experience creating, managing, and maintaining websites with a focus on UX/UI
Experience working across both public and internal web platforms, particularly with WordPress and Google Sites

Understanding of web development processes and technologies
