title: UX Designer
job_description:
About Us:
HavocAI is an innovative defense technology company making scalable maritime autonomy a reality. We are pioneering an end-to-end solution for planning, tasking and control of uncrewed surface vessels (USVs). As we continue to quickly grow, we are looking for motivated individuals that are inspired to work within an extremely energetic, creative, and innovative team that is passionate about maritime robotics and exploring the open ocean. We work in a highly dynamic environment where collaboration and idea sharing are a way of life.


About the Role:
We're looking for a User Experience (UX) Designer to join our product team and collaborate closely with a team of UX Engineers on the design of cutting-edge, map-based applications. In this role, you'll be responsible for transforming complex user needs and data-heavy workflows into clear, intuitive interfaces. You'll drive the research and design process from early discovery through interactive prototyping and handoff, working in lockstep with engineers to ensure implementation fidelity.
This role requires a strong foundation in interaction design, visual communication, and user research—especially in technical or data-intensive environments. You should be comfortable with ambiguity, excited by complex problem spaces, and eager to turn abstract requirements into concrete design systems.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead UX design for a real-time C2 platform supporting collaborative autonomous vehicle operations.
Design interfaces that make sense of complex, streaming sensor data and geospatial information on interactive maps.
Partner directly with UX Engineers to define flows, layouts, behaviors, and visualizations that maintain situational awareness and reduce cognitive load.
Conduct user research (e.g., stakeholder interviews, usability testing, journey mapping) to validate concepts and refine workflows.
Develop wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes using tools like Figma, Sketch, or Framer.
Translate mission planning, vehicle control, and sensor monitoring workflows into intuitive user flows and clear visual hierarchies.
Create and maintain design systems, reusable patterns, and UX documentation to ensure cohesive design at scale.
Advocate for user-centered design best practices across engineering, product, and operational teams.
Support the implementation process by delivering detailed design specs, providing feedback on builds, and QA'ing UX fidelity.
Qualifications:
3–6 years of experience designing interactive digital products, ideally for technical, operational, or data-intensive applications.
Proven ability to design clear interfaces for complex systems involving real-time data or sensor feeds.
Proficiency with Figma or similar tools for prototyping and visual design.
Demonstrated experience collaborating closely with frontend engineers in agile, cross-functional teams.
Solid understanding of interaction design principles, visual hierarchy, typography, and usability heuristics.
Experience conducting user research and usability studies to inform design decisions.
Comfortable working in complex, evolving problem spaces with ambiguous requirements.
Excellent communication, presentation, and documentation skills.
Must be a U.S. citizen due to project requirements.
Preferred Skills:
Experience working with geospatial data, GIS tools, or real-time visualization platforms.
Familiarity with design for WebGL, Mapbox, Deck.gl (http://deck.gl/), or similar frameworks.
Basic understanding of HTML/CSS/React to better collaborate with engineers.
Exposure to accessibility and performance considerations for technical web applications.
Prior work in defense, aerospace, robotics, or real-time operational environments is a strong plus.
Location:
This position can be 100% remote and must sit within the United States
Some travel is required
Compensation and Benefits:
The target salary range for this position is $120,000 - $150,000
100% Employer paid Health, Dental and Vision Insurance for you and your families
Ability to participate in the companies 401k program
Unlimited PTO policy with an enforced 2 week minimum
Equity Package
Work / Home Office Stipend
Global Entry Re-Imbursement
16 Week Paid Parental Leave
Monthly Health and Wellness Stipend


Our Values:
Innovation: We are driven to break new ground. Every day presents an opportunity to challenge the status quo, think boldly, and deliver advanced solutions that transform the future of defense technology.
Integrity: We hold ourselves to the highest ethical standards, ensuring transparency, accountability, and trust in all our actions and partnerships.
Mission-Driven: We are focused on achieving impactful outcomes that align with our core mission—protecting lives through innovation.
Forward-Leaning: We continuously seek out new opportunities and remain at the forefront of technological advancements. We embrace change and anticipate the challenges of tomorrow with confidence and creativity.
Ownership of All Tasks: At HavocAI, no problem is too complex or too trivial. We believe that greatness comes from tackling the hardest challenges, but also in handling the smallest, sometimes thankless, tasks with the same level of commitment and care.
Servant Leadership: We lead by serving others, whether it's supporting our employees, partners, or the broader community. Empowering those around us is key to achieving long-term success and making a lasting impact.

HavocAI is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

title: UI UX Designer and Developer
job_description:
At Files.com, we build technology so businesses can manage file transfer and security at scale. We are private equity backed, profitable, and lead our industry in terms of revenue per employee. This means that each and every team member is able to have a high degree of direct responsibility and impact.

We are a SaaS, Cloud-Based Managed File Transfer platform that enables organizations to securely transfer, share, and store files between users, teams, and organizations.

Location: Work From Your Home on a Remote-First Team

World Class Pay and Benefits

Earn a "Bay Area" Salary from Anywhere. Our pay is competitive with the top software companies in the world, with generous base salary plus equity compensation.

Big Company Benefits: You'll get full Health/Dental/Vision Insurance coverage (plus 75% of Spouse/Family coverage too), 401(k) with generous matching, 11 Company Holidays per year, and 20 PTO/Vacation days, plus we give employees off for Winter Break at the end of the year!

Company Macbook Pro and $1,000: We'll send you a company issued contemporary Macbook Pro as well as $1,000 sign-on bonus as a welcome to Files.com.

Tight-Knit Fun-Loving Team: You will be joining a fun-loving team that works together very closely, despite the remote work environment.

100% Remote Opportunity

About the Role

Our apps and marketing websites are driven by a modern frontend React and Gatsby-based stack. In this position, you will build new designs and improve existing flows, working directly in React, Figma, and other design tools. Your work at Files.com would be used by hundreds of thousands of corporate users.

UI/UX Designer and Developer Responsibilities:
Skilled at creating interaction design solutions
Understand primary personas of the product and map to their use of the product
Gathering and evaluating user requirements, in collaboration with product managers and engineers specific to platform UX
Design user journeys across functions from concept to production ready with design tools (Figma)
Create prototypes and wireframes
Design graphic user interface elements which will be uniformly used across the product: e.g: menus, tabs, tables, and widgets
Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
Conduct concept and usability testing and gather feedback
Resolve design-related issues in the app and marketing site by writing JSX and advanced CSS directly in a branch
Experience using react.js to develop web applications
Document component-level UI in our Storybook.js
Qualifications:
5+ years of design and development experience for a software solution
Strong experience in design tools like Figma or Adobe XD, Adobe Suite, Sketch
Proficient in Web development including HTML, JS, CSS, React.js
Skilled at creating interaction design solutions
Strong visual design skills, able to create compelling, branded, high-fidelity product screens
Familiar working with design systems that consistently scale across platforms
Experience in designing systems and tools to enable cross team interactions and collaboration
Hands-on experience designing SaaS and B2B applications
Creative problem solving and analytical skills with ability to synthesize ideas into tangible solutions for design
Strong portfolio of design projects
Show us a great resume! We are eager to see the design decisions you make when representing yourself!

title: UI/UX Designer
job_description:
Overview:
Corporate Tools is hiring an experienced UI/UX Designer for $100,000/year. You will be a traditional company employee. This is a full time M-F position with company benefits. This is a remote position. Our main office is in Spokane WA, and we have satellite offices in Austin TX and Salt Lake City UT.
We are looking for someone who has previous experience empathizing and understanding what the end-user wants by researching and learning how the software is used and coming up with solutions that meet those needs. This person needs to be Figma and Javascript savvy. Someone who can excel at turning mocks into a polished functional website and help bridge the gap from UI/UX to our full-stack developers who will implement your designs. The primary responsibilities will include creating and translating UI/UX design wireframes into HTML and CSS. You may also be taking existing software pages and refreshing these with a new modern look. If you like to go the extra mile to help make software more appealing to the eye — you will fit right in. Our projects range in size from completely re-vamping an entire application, to refreshing small pieces of a bigger product.
Wage:
$100,000/year
Benefits:
100% employer-paid medical, dental and vision for employees
Annual review with raise option
22 days Paid Time Off accrued annually, and 4 holidays
After 3 years, PTO increases to 29 days. Employees transition to flexible time off after 5 years with the company—not accrued, not capped, take time off when you want
The 4 holidays are: New Year’s Day, Fourth of July, Thanksgiving, and Christmas Day
Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave
Up to 5% company matching 401(k) with no vesting period
Quarterly allowance
Use to make your remote work set up more comfortable, for continuing education classes, a plant for your desk, coffee for your coworker, a massage for yourself... really, whatever
Open concept office with friendly coworkers
Creative environment where you can make a difference
No dumb benefits like free dog walking on the weekends that snobby hipster places have to make you feel cool, but mathematically won't cost the company much money because you won't use it
Trail Mix Bar
- oh yeah
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with our full-stack teams to develop common UI components and design patterns that can be adopted and extended across product suites
Work daily with design language and UI consistency
Create wire frames, storyboards, user flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
Be the connection between our full-stack and design team by being fluent in HTML/CSS
Develop innovative user interfaces and interactive models that leverage next generation web technologies to improve user productivity and operational efficiency
Researching and deeply understanding problems so you can get to the root of what’s really important
Requirements:
3+ years experience in a UI/UX position
Strong understanding of Figma and Javascript
Understanding of HTML, and CSS
Knowledge of design and development best practice
Working knowledge of industry tools, such as Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Sketch, Zeplin, Adobe xD, Invision etc
Excellent ability to manage timelines and be self-directed
Experience with using UX research methods to make informed UI/UX decisions
Familiarity with A/B testing and gathering and analyzing user interactions
UI/UX Designer
Remote | Spokane | Austin | SLC

title: UX Designer
job_description:
DaySmart supercharges experience-based businesses with innovative, industry-specific software services that power customer and revenue growth. With thousands of partners worldwide and dozens of industry awards, we provide best-in-class solutions to accelerate their business.
DaySmart Beauty delivers cloud-based software designed for salons, spas, and the tattoo and piercing industries. With over 20 years of experience, we simplify business operations by streamlining scheduling, automating tasks, and improving client interactions. Our platform manages everything from appointments to payments, empowering businesses to focus on offering exceptional client service.
As a UX Designer, you will play a crucial role in crafting intuitive and visually appealing interface, experience, and interaction design for our products servicing our beauty customers. This position is ideal for a creative and detail-oriented professional who excels in user-centered design and has a passion for understanding user needs and behaviors, as well as performing qualitative customer interviews and research. Experience in designing products for beauty and wellness customers is a plus.
What You Will Do
Interface, Experience, and Interaction Design: Deliver excellent wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing. Ensure designs are consistent with our style guide and brand identity.
Product Discovery: Conduct user research and qualitative discovery to understand the evolving needs, behaviors, and pain points for our beauty industry customers. Analyze data alongside the product management team to inform design decisions and improve the customer experience.
Product Strategy: Explore complex, ambiguous problem spaces, working with your team to understand the opportunity, and then chart a path forward together.
Thought Leadership: Serve as the voice of the customer and drive process improvements which ensure alignment and buy-in from technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product management, engineering, marketing, sales, and customer support teams to ensure seamless implementation of designs and maintain a unified product vision.
Goal Oriented: Align design thinking to our business north star and OKRs, and measure everything we deliver to learn from and evaluate success.
What You Will Bring
Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field. Advanced degrees are a plus.
3+ years of experience in product design, including 2+ years servicing SMB SaaS customers.
Demonstrate a strong portfolio showcasing your expertise in designing intuitive user interfaces and experiences.
Experience in the beauty or wellness industry and designing mobile applications.
Proficient in design tools such as Figma and Maze.
Usage of product analytics, goals, and data to drive design decisions.
Deep understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies, with experience conducting user research and usability testing.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate design decisions and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with keen attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality design solutions.
Experience using Pendo is a plus.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, remote work environment, managing multiple projects and deadlines effectively.
Salary
The salary range for this role is $75,000 to $100,00 per year. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, internal equity, etc.
What We Offer
Competitive salary and benefits including medical, dental, vision, HSA, FSA, and more!
401k plan with company match on your contributions.
Open PTO and a generous paid holiday schedule.
Supportive work environment with the flexibility to work where/how you want – in-office, remote, or hybrid.
Opportunities to ensure you are always learning and growing.
How You Will Work
This will be a US based position. We offer flexible work arrangements including fully remote, in person or hybrid opportunities. For those looking to work in person, we have physical offices in the following cities:
Ann Arbor, MI
Scottsdale, AZ
Wayne, PA
Austin, TX
DaySmart is committed to creating a diverse employee environment and is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.
Please refer to DaySmart Privacy Policy to learn more about how we are committed to respecting your privacy and the security of your personal information.

title: UX Designer
job_description:
Important Notice for Applicants:
At Bixal, we want to ensure a transparent and secure application process for all candidates. Official communication will come from an email address ending in @bixal.com or from talent@bixal.com. Messages from other sources may be fraudulent, and you should exercise care to avoid any links or attachments included.
Bixal will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.
Need Assistance or a Reasonable Accommodation?
If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation to complete your application, we're here to help. Please reach out to us at talent@bixal.com and let us know how we can support you. You do not need to share personal details or disclose the nature of your request. You can expect a response from a team member within 24 hours during the regular work week and on the next operating day during the weekend or holidays.
*
Why Bixal?*
Bixal is a consulting company headquartered in Fairfax, VA, working alongside governments and organizations to help them deliver better services and experiences to the communities they serve. Using evidence-based knowledge and technology, Bixal empowers clients to deliver on their missions more effectively by fostering a culture of learning and continuous improvement.
Our values:
People-First: Emphasizing the importance of people in all aspects of work.
Collaboration and Transparency: Valuing teamwork and open communication.
Growth Mindset: Encouraging innovation and continuous improvement.
Creating Lasting Impact: Focusing on meaningful outcomes and positive change.
About the role:
Bixal is seeking a highly skilled UX Designer to join our team and help us deliver exceptional user experiences for our government clients. The UX Designer will collaborate with cross-functional teams to conduct user research, develop service wireframes, and ensure backend services support intuitive, accessible, and consistent user experiences across web and mobile platforms. They will play a key role in aligning back-end capabilities with front-end design needs, using human-centered design principles to improve the Veteran experience across the VA’s digital health tools.
This is a full-time position contingent on contract award by our client, with a defined performance period of one year with two one-year option periods. This role offers you a unique opportunity to make a meaningful impact on a project that aligns with Bixal’s mission of delivering innovative, human-centered solutions. While the role has a fixed duration, we are committed to transparency and collaboration, keeping you informed about contract updates and new opportunities. At Bixal, we support your professional journey, ensuring your experience reflects our inclusive, purpose-driven culture and prepares you for future success.
Compensation:
The salary range for this role is $67,500 – $77,500. In the spirit of transparency, most offers tend to land near the midpoint of the range. We make compensation decisions thoughtfully, considering your experience, the skills you bring, and our commitment to internal equity. Fairness and transparency are core to how we operate.
Responsibilities:
Conducting user research to understand the needs, goals, and preferences of government employees and citizens who use our digital products and services
Creating user personas, user journeys, wireframes, and prototypes that effectively communicate design ideas and concepts to stakeholders
Collaborating with other designers, developers, and project managers to ensure that design solutions are aligned with project requirements and timelines
Conducting usability testing and gathering feedback from users to continuously improve the user experience
Supporting the development of design processes, workflows, and standards that enable efficient and effective design operations
Staying up-to-date with the latest design trends, tools, and techniques, and sharing knowledge with the team to promote a culture of innovation and continuous improvement
Other duties and responsibilities as trained and qualified to perform.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a related field, plus at least 3 years of relevant experience.
Experience in UX design, preferably in a federal consulting or government environment
Strong portfolio that demonstrates a range of UX design skills, including user research, wireframing, prototyping, and visual design
Proficiency in design tools such as Sketch, Figma, or Adobe Creative Suite
Understanding of human-centered design principles and methodologies
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment
Familiarity with accessibility and Section 508 compliance guidelines is a plus
Must be able to pass and maintain a Public Trust security clearance
*
How We Support Our Team:*
Flex hours
401K with matching incentive
Parental Leave
Medical/dental/vision benefits
Flex Spending Account
Company provided short-term disability and life insurance
Commuter benefits
Paid Time Off (PTO)
11 Paid holidays
Our company is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all individuals and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local anti-discrimination laws. Employment decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and business needs.
Pay: $90,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year
Work Location: Remote

title: UX Designer
job_description:
Proficient in UX design principles with a strong online portfolio showcasing passed UX experience. (Required to supply online portfolio with application)
Primary Skill Required:
User Experience Designers will have a primary focus of user research (creating research plans, facilitating the research, and synthesize the findings) using the insights to propose recommendations and design solutions (wireframing and low-fidelity designs) for intuitive new/improved user experiences.
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
3+ years hands-on experience as UX Designer, preferably as a member of UX team(s)
2+ years hands-on experience in UX design, UX research or UX interaction design
Must have the ability to lead creation of user personas, experience maps, and information architecture
Familiarity with digital design and understanding digital analytics
Uses the UX design process to approach solving digital design challenges
Experienced with creating and conducting moderated and unmoderated usability studies
Experienced with common design software (Figma, Axure, Adobe products, Keynote/PPT for the creation of IXD artifacts, documentation, and presentations -or- fluency with Photoshop and Illustrator
Ability to design for and execute across multiple interfaces, platforms and channels (Web, email, mobile, social media)
Fluent in responsive design
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Ability to communicate ideas through effective storytelling with sketches, wireframes, comps and prototypes
Familiarity with Google Analytics or other Web analytics solutions (Google Analytics, Optimizely, Contentsquare)
Familiarity with ADA compliance requirements
Understanding of branding as it relates to user experience
Strong communication and presentation skills
Humility and recognition that you don't have all the answers
Adaptability and an enthusiasm for continuous learning
Creativity, imagination and a sense of humor
Places high value on the diverse strengths, backgrounds, and talents others bring to the workforce.

PREFERRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Bachelor's degree in design or related field
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience designing for mobile platforms (iOS and Android)
Interest and participation in professional industry groups, conferences

User Experience Designers:
Advocate for users across the organization and communicate the value and principles of user-centered design
Iterate on ideas based upon validated learning, critique, and collaboration
Create personas, user flows, empathy maps, journey maps, experience maps, information architecture and other documents to document and communicate research findings
Design task analysis, user flows and stories, navigation, content hierarchies, interaction design, and functioning prototypes
Establish and evolve designs to meet user needs under various scenarios (browser, screen size, screen readers, etc.)
Understand digital accessibility and design using best practices for ADA compliance to ensure that designs and code provide progressive enhancements and accessibility for all users
Engage in project strategy planning
Effectively manage their workflow to meet expectations and deadlines
Collaborate with Developers to solve UX issues with layout and functionality-based solutions
Work closely with Stakeholders, Project Managers, Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Business Analyst, Architects, UX
Researchers, UX Visual Designers and Developers documenting detailed design requirements
Iterate on designs based on user feedback results
Build interactive prototypes for usability studies
Participate in key meetings including daily stand-ups and planning sessions
Inform the design process of opportunities and challenges presented by the medium through which the user will experience the product
Stay current with UX, tools and technology
Champion the UX approach in other departments


Services Description:
As a key member of our Digital Experience & Design team, the User Experience (UX) Designers are responsible for user-centered design, visualizing, and executing strategic user experiences in our digital products. This role excels as a passionate designer, collaborator, customer advocate, and continuous learner. Focused on creating delightful experiences that match user/customer needs with business goals, while reinforcing the Company's brand image. And, will work closely with a team of designers, developers, and content strategists, as well as technology and business partners throughout the UX design process.

Deliverables Description (if applicable):
The UX Designer will design, facilitate, and analyze various user research activities, including user testing, interviews, and observations, while leveraging user research insights and business strategy requirements to create innovate interactive web/mobile/tablet application concepts, and drive them to completion. They will be captivated by understanding and serving as a champion for the user/customer in every discussion and at every decision point.

title: Experienced UX/UI Designers
job_description:
Job Title: Senior UX/UI Designer
Location: Remote
Company: Vicarious Talent Agency
About Vicarious Talent Agency: Located in Seattle, Vicarious Talent Agency is a renowned recruiting agency specializing in placing highly influential content creators and other creative talent across various sectors. Our mission is to connect skilled professionals with leading companies worldwide, leveraging innovative strategies and deep industry insights.
Position Overview: We are seeking experienced UX/UI designers to augment our client's internal team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with design systems in larger corporate settings, bringing a wealth of knowledge in creating intuitive and impactful user experiences. This role requires a deep understanding of user-centered design principles and the ability to adapt and innovate within established brand guidelines.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and refine UX/UI design systems that align with corporate standards and brand consistency.
Collaborate with product teams to design and implement user-friendly digital experiences.
Lead UX/UI projects, including conducting user research, creating wireframes, and designing high-fidelity prototypes.
Work closely with developers to ensure accurate implementation of designs and maintain design consistency throughout the development process.
Mentor junior designers, sharing knowledge and best practices in UX/UI design.
Stay up-to-date with the latest design trends and technologies to continuously improve the user experience.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in UX/UI design, specifically in a larger agency environment or client-side within a large corporate environment.
Strong portfolio showcasing expertise in UX/UI design and success in using design systems.
Proficient in design tools such as Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, and InVision.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong user-focused orientation.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills.
Compensation:
Competitive salary, commensurate with experience and qualifications.
Benefits package includes health, dental, and vision insurance, plus opportunities for professional development.
Why Join Us:
Work remotely and collaborate with a team that pushes the boundaries of digital design.
Be part of a dynamic environment where innovation and creativity are valued.
Engage with large-scale projects that impact major corporations and their consumers.
Application Process: Interested candidates are encouraged to apply through our online portal by clicking below.
————————
At Vicarious Creative Talent Staffing Agency, we celebrate, encourage, and support diversity as an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Application and Web Information Technology Accessibility Specialist
job_description:
Koniag Management Solutions, a Koniag Government Services company, is seeking an Application and Web Information Technology Accessibility Specialist to support KMS and our government customer. This is a remote opportunity.

We offer competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, three weeks paid time off, and more.
Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:
Senior IT Accessibility Specialist that Specializes in Application and Web compliance:
The Senior IT Accessibility Specialist shall provide subject matter expertise regarding Section 508 program & policy support.
The Senior IT Accessibility Specialist will liaise with agency components to provide guidance for Section 508 compliance and Trusted Tester methodologies, draft and maintain Section 508 policy and process documentation, provide consultation services throughout the software development and procurement lifecycle to ensure delivery of Section 508 conformant software and hardware products, and validate reported Section 508 issues.
The Senior IT Accessibility Specialist also provides direction and guidance to IT Accessibility Specialists.
Minimum Experience (Specialize in Section 508 application testing):
Five years’ experience working in a department or agency Section 508 compliance/accessibility program office.
Two years of experience of Section 508 knowledge on creating policy and integrating new guidelines into an existing policy
Three years of experience in evaluating, documenting, reporting, and validating program applications, website, and other developed ICT for Section 508 compliances
Three years’ experience with the federal acquisition process and requirements and with Enterprise IT Lifecycle
Sensitivity Level: IT level I
Capable of evaluating web pages, web applications, and software for Section 508 compliance according to the DHS Trusted Tester 5.1 process.
Capable of creating Accessibility Conformance Reports (ACRs) and Remediation Plan templates based on Section 508 accessibility testing for each website or application tested.
Capable of managing and maintaining storage of all testing-related documentation, including ACRs and Remediation Plans.
Capable of meeting regularly with development team Project Managers or points of contact (POCs) to review Section 508 test results.
Capable of developing 508 compliant documents for the Section 508 Program Management
Capable of developing and delivering Virtual Instructor-Led Training (VILT) events on Section 508 web/application accessibility standards.
DHS Trusted Tester certified.
Familiar with web software development (i.e., PowerApps, HTML, CSS, and/or JavaScript)
Familiar with Section 508 document remediation (recommended)
Capable of remediating a one-page document of medium complexity for Section 508 in compliance with the latest WCAG standards within 15 minutes, without human assistance, using automated and manual testing (recommended)
Proficient with the agency currently approved versions of the following software:
Microsoft Windows 11
Microsoft 365 Office Suite
Adobe Acrobat
Freedom Scientific Fusion
Job Access With Speech (JAWS)
ZoomText
Allyant Commonlook Office/PDF Suite (recommended)
Colour Contrast Analyser (CCA)
SSA Accessible Name and Description Inspector (ANDI)
DHS Accessibility Conformance Reporting Tool (ACRT)
Must comply with all Section 508 Content Testing capability.
Our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy
The company is an equal opportunity employer. The company shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, creed, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), national origin or ancestry, age, disability, citizenship, military/veteran status, marital status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. We are committed to equal employment opportunity in all decisions related to employment, promotion, wages, benefits, and all other privileges, terms, and conditions of employment.

The company is dedicated to seeking all qualified applicants. If you require an accommodation to navigate or apply for a position on our website, please get in touch with Heaven Wood via e-mail at accommodations@koniag-gs.com or by calling 703-488-9377 to request accommodations.

Koniag Government Services (KGS) is an Alaska Native Owned corporation supporting the values and traditions of our native communities through an agile employee and corporate culture that delivers Enterprise Solutions, Professional Services and Operational Management to Federal Government Agencies. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Koniag, we apply our proven commercial solutions to a deep knowledge of Defense and Civilian missions to provide forward leaning technical, professional, and operational solutions. KGS enables successful mission outcomes for our customers through solution-oriented business partnerships and a commitment to exceptional service delivery. We ensure long-term success with a continuous improvement approach while balancing the collective interests of our customers, employees, and native communities. For more information, please visit www.koniag-gs.com.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. Shareholder Preference in accordance with Public Law 88-352

title: DevOps Engineer
job_description:
We’re looking for a DevOps Engineer to design, deploy, and maintain robust infrastructure while streamlining CI/CD processes. You’ll work with modern cloud and containerization technologies to ensure high availability, security, and performance across environments.
If you enjoy solving infrastructure challenges and optimizing deployments, we’d love to hear from you!
Responsibilities
Server Management: Experience in managing and maintaining servers.
Kubernetes: Strong knowledge of Kubernetes for container orchestration.
GitLab Pipelines: Experience in creating and managing CI/CD pipelines in GitLab.
Database Management: Familiarity with database systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB.
Elasticsearch: Familiarity with Elasticsearch for search and analytics.
Backup and Recovery: Knowledge of backup and recovery strategies.
Docker: Proficiency in Docker for containerization.
Networking: Solid understanding of network protocols and configurations.
Scripting: Ability to write scripts in languages like Bash, Python, or PowerShell.
Monitoring and Logging: Experience with monitoring tools and logging systems.
Requirements
Cloud Platforms: Experience with cloud services like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Security: Proficiency in handling passwords, logins, and VPN setup.
Configuration Management: Knowledge of tools like Ansible, Puppet, or Chef.
Automation: Experience with automation tools and frameworks.
Sentry: Experience with on-premises Sentry for error tracking.
Load Balancing: Understanding of load balancing techniques and tools.
Compliance: Awareness of compliance standards and best practices.
Soft Skills: Strong communication, problem-solving, and teamwork abilities.
Continuous Learning: Willingness to stay updated with the latest technologies and trends.
Project Management: Basic understanding of project management principles.
Nice to have
PHP

title: DevOps Engineer
job_description:
We inspire purpose-filled living that brings joy to the modern home. With a team of more than 8,000 associates spanning 130 store and distribution locations across the U.S. and Canada, we achieve together, drive results and innovate to inspire. Drawn together by a shared passion for our customers and a spirit of fun, we deliver high-quality home furnishings that are expertly designed, responsibly sourced and bring beauty and function to people’s homes. From the day we opened our first store in Chicago in 1962 to the digital innovations that engage millions of customers today, our iconic brand is over 60 years in the making—and our story is still unfolding.

We’re here for it. We think you should be too. We’re looking for a driven professional with an inclusive mindset to join our team as a DevOps Engineer.

A DevOps Engineer will collaborate to manage infrastructure projects and processes. They will be part of a team supporting production, monitoring, and operations for our retail websites. They should have strong intellectual curiosity to analyze and interpret the data to improve website performance.

This role is an Individual Contributor position which can be worked fully remote.

A day in the life as a DevOps Engineer…

Design, implement, and maintain cloud infrastructure on AWS and GCP using Terraform, focusing on automation and scalability.
Improve website scalability to automatically handle traffic surges while balancing site reliability and cost
Add build gates (regression tests, linting, security scans) to code deployment pipelines to reduce production incidents and improve release velocity.
Proactively monitor real-time application performance to identify areas for improvement
Implement production fixes and contribute to root cause analysis to minimize disruptions to customer experience.
Implement and manage access control policies for production databases and tools, adhering to zero-trust security principles

What you’ll bring to the table…

Strong working knowledge in at least one scripting language (e.g. Python, Bash, Powershell)
Experience using Cloud providers (AWS and/or GCP)
Familiarity with common cybersecurity standards and best practices
Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities effectively to support multiple teams developing disparate applications
Strong communication skills to collaborate efficiently, effectively and respectively with teammates
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or comparable work experience
Demonstrated experience in a production software development/deployment environment
Maintaining iOS CI/CD pipelines using fastlane and xcodebuild
Experience managing iOS app signing certificates, provisioning profiles, and app entitlements
Experience with Swift Package Manager

We’d love to hear from you if you have…

Proficient in developing and maintaining automated CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Teamcity, Octopus Deploy), including experience managing and adhering to a standard Git workflow
Deep understanding of infrastructure-as-code principles and demonstrated ability to automate infrastructure management with Terraform
Understanding of.NET/C# and JavaScript programming concepts.
Skilled in using Docker and Kubernetes for container orchestration. Familiarity with Istio service mesh is a plus.
Knowledge of relational database management systems, including PostgreSQL and MySQL
Hands-on experience with setting up and configuring monitoring tools (New Relic, Datadog, etc.) and creating informative dashboards.

#li-remote

Minimum Starting Rate: $80,000.00 Annually

Up to: $100,000.00 Annually

Pay ranges will be adjusted upward as needed to comply with applicable state and local law. In addition to your salary, based on your role, associates may be eligible for other compensation including bonuses, sales incentives, and long term incentives.

title: Application/DevOps Engineer
job_description:
Summary
Location: 100% Remote - U.S. Time Zones ONLY
Commitment: Part-Time
Position Type: Hourly/Contractor Direct (No Agencies)
We are looking for a highly skilled Application/DevOps Engineer who is experienced in all application hoisting a DevOps technologies. Application/DevOps Engineers are responsible for consulting with Engineering Manager and Architect in Application architectures, frameworks, and approaches as well as engineering solution implementations of defined system architectures.
.
***We are looking for an Independent Contractor (1099) who can be flexible with an “on-call” work schedule as needs increase or decrease.***
Details
Specific Responsibilities:
Consult with Engineering Manager and Architect in Application architectures, frameworks, and approaches.
Engineer the application implementation of defined system architectures including:
KPIs, targets, and tooling to measure application and third-party service performance related to the application,
Capture Domain design in accordance with Customer Requirements (DDD and BDD),
Documentation including architecture of deployed solutions, monitoring and support components, etc.,
Identify and document design decision points, propose approaches, and communicate for review and clarification.
Overseeing the development of documentation.
Ensure compliance and performance of developed applications through:
Definition of Best Practices and Standards,
Code Review,
Ensuring adherence to application architecture, application and development standards and practices,
And timely communication of identified issues to reduce potential cost risks.
Assist the PM with communications with clients and cross-functional departments to communicate project statuses and proposals.
Assist in root cause analysis for identified defects.
Communicating key project data to team members and building cohesion among teams.
Developing and executing project plans and tasks as assigned.

General Responsibilities:
Provide Tier 3 Support for escalation from Operations as assigned.
Engage Third-Party Service Providers as necessary to resolve systemic issues.
Document best practices, application standards, and standard operating procedures.
Developing and coordinating software system validation and testing methods.
Support Change Management Process through contribution in required Change Documentation and CAB Participation as Requested.
Establish, document, and communicate initial approaches to new application challenges.
Analyzing data to effectively coordinate the installation of new systems or the modification of existing systems.
Work with Dev Team Lead and Dev PM in the development, documentation and maintenance the software development lifecycle.
Ensure implementation of application components to provide effective monitoring of solution performance.
Maintain understanding of emerging technologies applicable to our current and planned products and services.
Proposing and implementing innovative solutions to meet our company’s technical needs.
Play a key role in shaping the future of our solutions and services.
Required Technical Skillsets:
Automation and DevOps(CI/CD) Toolsets (Jenkins, CodePipeline, CodeBuild, CodeDeploy)
Linux (Ubuntu, Centos) and Windows Server Engineering and Administration
Docker, ECS/Kubernetes Engineering
Platform Engineering experience including .NET, PHP/Laravel, Node.js
AWS Cloud Service Engineering (all)
Azure/365 Engineering (all)
Caching Services (REDIS, Elasticache)
Routing & Security (DNS, WAF, GSLB)
Other qualifications:
Must have reliable high speed internet.
Must be able to communicate in English. You'll be expected to provide regular updates on your work via our PM tool as well as our twice weekly Scrum calls.
Must be able to provide effective documentation.
Must be a team player and able to dedicate 20+ hours a week when required.
Must complete a skills assessment to qualify for the position.
No agencies will be considered.

title: DevOps Engineer
job_description:
Company Overview: Comprehensive practice management solutions for the elective medical industry are essential for improving efficiency, and the client-centric culture of the PatientNow team is well-poised to continue delivering solutions that allow our customers to spend more time where they want to, with their patients. With our expanding line of products, we demonstrate our commitment to delivering purpose-built technology to medical aesthetics and wellness service providers in our ever evolving market. PatientNow continues to see Med Spa business growth, in addition to expansion in the areas of nutrition, weight loss and hormone replacement. PatientNow’s goal is to be the elective medical industry’s most trusted and intuitive practice management solution— fueled by innovation, integration, and strategic partnerships, delivered by a team with unrivaled grit.

Vision - Empowering practices and businesses to improve health and wellness worldwide by helping their clients look and feel their best.

Mission - PatientNow is elevating businesses focused on beauty, wellness and medical aesthetics with innovative, all-in-one software and consulting service solutions. People who partner with us stand out in the industry with strong market differentiation, while streamlining operations for long term success and sustainable growth.

Values –
Show up – being present and supportive: for each other through collaboration and respect, for our customers with exceptional service, and for the business with dedication to excellence and growth.
Own the outcome – By understanding the objective, exceeding expectations with pride, confirming resolution, communicating early and often, and continuously learning and improving
Be Authentic - By sharing thoughts and opinions, keeping promises, showing your true self, and engaging with respect

Position Summary: The DevOps Engineer plays a critical role in supporting the delivery, stability, and scalability of our cloud-native SaaS platform. This mid-level position focuses on implementing automation across CI/CD pipelines, managing infrastructure using IaC tools, and ensuring environment consistency within a fully AWS-hosted ecosystem. The role works closely with cross-functional teams to maintain observability, troubleshoot deployment issues, and integrate security best practices. Through hands-on execution and collaboration, the DevOps Engineer helps drive efficiency, reliability, and alignment with organizational goals.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Build and enhance automation for Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Delivery (CDE), and Continuous Deployment (CD) workflows.
Develop and maintain infrastructure provisioning and configuration using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or AWS CDK.
Contribute to provisioning efforts to ensure consistent and reliable environments across development, testing, and production.
Manage source control strategies and branching models to ensure clean and consistent versioning across codebases.
Integrate automated unit, performance, and security testing into CI/CD pipelines.
Maintain observability tooling—including dashboards, metrics, logging, and alerting—with solutions such as Datadog and AWS CloudWatch.
Leverage AWS-native tools such as CloudWatch and X-Ray for real-time performance insights and debugging.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues across cloud infrastructure, build pipelines, and deployment environments.
Continuously evaluate pipeline performance and recommend improvements for speed, reliability, and cost-efficiency.
Assist in managing build artifacts using platforms such as Artifactory, NuGet, or GitHub Packages to support version-controlled deployments.
Support system configuration and provisioning through tools like Ansible, Chef, or Puppet.
Foster partnerships with internal teams (Software Engineering, Quality Assurance, Product Management, Cybersecurity, IT Infrastructure) enabling alignment with organizational objectives.
Competencies: To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following.

Adaptability - Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles. Measures self against standard of excellence. Recognizes and acts on opportunities. Sets and achieves challenging goals. Takes calculated risks to accomplish goals.

Business Ethics – Inspires the trust of others. Keeps commitments. Treats people with respect. Upholds organizational values. Works with integrity and ethically.

Communications - Exhibits good listening and comprehension. Expresses ideas and thoughts in written form. Expresses ideas and thoughts verbally. Keeps others adequately informed. Selects and uses appropriate communication methods.

Continuous Learning - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses. Pursues training and development opportunities. Seeks feedback to improve performance. Shares expertise with others. Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills.

Problem Solving - Develops alternative solutions. Gathers and analyzes information skillfully. Identifies problems in a timely manner. Resolves problems in early stages. Works well in group problem solving situations.

Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities. Contributes to building a positive team spirit. Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views. Gives and welcomes feedback. Puts success of team above own interests.

Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field preferred; equivalent professional experience will be considered.
5+ years in DevOps, site reliability, or infrastructure-focused roles supporting cloud-native software development.
Strong working knowledge of CI/CD principles with hands-on use of GitHub Actions, AWS CodePipeline, and CodeBuild for automation, testing, and deployment.
Proven ability to support build and release workflows for .NET/C# and Angular applications, along with familiarity with Python, Node.js, and React.
Skilled in managing AWS services across compute, storage, networking, IAM, and provisioning tasks.
Well-versed in toolchains such as Ansible, Artifactory, AWS CLI, AWS Systems Manager, Docker, GitHub, GitHub Packages, and Jira.
Applied Infrastructure as Code using tools like Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or AWS CDK.
Comfortable working in Linux environments such as Redhat or Ubuntu.
Proficient in scripting with Python, PowerShell, YAML, or Bash to automate operational tasks.
Capable of leveraging observability platforms like Datadog and AWS CloudWatch for monitoring, logging, and alerting.
Team-oriented and resourceful, with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in cross-functional, fast-paced environments.

Supervisory Responsibilities:
This position does not have supervisory responsibilities.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit at a desk and work on a computer for prolonged periods.

title: DevOps Engineer
job_description:
At Cameo, we make impossible connections possible. Our platform allows fans to get personalized messages from their favorite comedians, actors, athletes, and more.... not gonna lie, it’s pretty magical. And now we’re looking for passionate, hardworking humans to help take Cameo to the next level.

Our #Fameo means everything to us. Join a stellar team of smart, curious, and driven individuals, and experience working at a globally known consumer startup.
Best in class. We’ve been named one of LinkedIn’s Top 50 Startups to Work For, voted one of America’s Best Startup Employers by Forbes, and the #1 Most Innovative Social Media Company by Fast Company.
Get all good stuff. Health insurance, 401(K), Fun work environment at our Downtown Chicago Headquarters, and opportunities to meet Cameo Talent!

Come to work every day knowing your efforts will have a material impact, shaping the direction of the next outstanding tech company!

About the role:
You will be helping us improve & scale the platform that connects fans and talent to create the perfect video shoutout. In particular, you will help us make sure we can support our growing fan base securely and performantly.
As our DevOps/Site Reliability Engineer, you will be working across multiple technologies, primarily supporting our backend API (node.js + express), databases (mongoDB + Redis), and infrastructure (AWS + Kubernetes/EKS + OpenTelemetry + Terraform).

Responsibilities:
As part of the Cameo Platform team continuously design, build, maintain and monitor the core infrastructure used by Cameo’s engineering teams
You’ll take part in the planning process for the growth of Cameo’s infrastructure
Become well versed with Cameo’s tech stack allowing you to debug production issues at all levels of the stack
You will help drive a DevOps mindset and culture across the engineering organization
You will collaborate with other teams like sales, marketing and data to make the talent experience fun and engaging, and help us deliver that perfect Cameo.


What you bring to the table:
2+ years experience supporting and monitoring web applications and infrastructure
Proficient in using various observability tools, including Grafana, OTel, X-Ray, and OpenSearch.
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Skilled in building and supporting containers
Familiar with a range of programming and scripting languages (Js/Ts, Python, Groovy, Bash)
Experience in implementing Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
Experience with CI/CD (Jenkins Declarative Pipelines) for both web and mobile applications
Knowledgeable in Kubernetes (EKS)
Familiarity with Kafka
Experience with NoSQL databases (Mongo, Redis)
Familiarity with NodeJS, React, ReactNative
You take pride in your work
You have a strong product sense
You are a doer who is comfortable with ambiguity
Benefits:
Competitive compensation package with benefits.
Collaborative work culture that encourages innovation and personal development.
Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options.
Opportunity for career growth and learning in the analytics and entertainment industries.

Cameo is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive and welcoming environment for every person who walks through our doors. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Cameo celebrates and embraces diversity.
The salary range for this position is $100,000 to $145,000 with opportunities for additional compensation based on performance. Cameo determines salary ranges by role and level with ranges for US roles typically based on our home market of Chicago. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within that range, individual pay is determined by job-related skills, experience, and relevant education and training. Posted salary ranges reflect base salary only, exclusive of equity, commissions, and other compensation and benefits.
Please consult the Notice to California Residents contained in Cameo's Privacy Policy available at https://www.cameo.com/privacy for information regarding your rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act if you are a California resident.

title: DevOps Engineer - AWS
job_description:
iFIT's vision is to create the world's most holistic health and fitness platform, integrating all elements of health - physical fitness, mental health, nutrition and active recovery - into a seamless interactive experience. We develop proprietary software that learns and adjusts to the habits of each person as it delivers immersive content that guides them on their own individual fitness journey.
We are currently seeking an ambitious pace-setter to join our team as a DevOps Engineer (Remote - U.S.).
ROLE COMMITMENTS
Operational Excellence: Improve operational processes and system observability to support our global member base
Product Engineering Support: Collaborate with Product teams to ensure that new features are delivered on-time and designed with scalability in mind
Product Expansion: Support infrastructure and system enhancements required to expand iFIT's reach and reliability as we grow internationally
Toil Reduction: Solve problems in an automated, sustainable manner, with a focus on empowering teams to spend more time on high-impact projects
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Build and manage AWS infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation, AWS CDK)
Collaborate with Platform teams on cloud architecture, IaC (Terraform) standards, and best practices
Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for TypeScript applications
Troubleshoot build and deployment issues and support feature rollouts
Document operational processes and author support runbooks
Automate manual processes to improve efficiency and reliability
Engage actively in daily team meetings and engineering rituals
Provide hands-on support for TypeScript application deployments
Requirements:
Education and Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience
7+ years as an AWS-focused DevOps Engineer managing infrastructure & (IaC) Terraform
5+ years experience as an application developer using strongly-typed language such as TypeScript
Experience with container technologies (Docker, ECS, Kubernetes)
Proven CI/CD pipeline experience
Preferred Qualifications
Proficiency in GitHub Actions
Familiarity with AWS security services (WAF, GuardDuty, CloudTrail)
Experience managing NoSQL (MongoDB) and relational databases (PostgreSQL)
Background in event-driven architecture
Knowledge of web frameworks (Express.js, Nest.js)
Familiarity with network fundamentals (TCP/IP, DNS, VPC configuration)
Experience in cost optimization strategies for AWS
Previous roles involving mentoring or training team members
Exposure to AI/ML infrastructure
AWS Cloud certifications

title: Devops Engineer
job_description:
Blue Acorn iCi is a leading digital consultancy focused on delivering innovative, scalable solutions across customer experience, commerce, and data. Backed by Infosys, we empower global brands with transformative digital experiences through our expert teams in strategy, analytics, design, and engineering. Whether it’s a digitally native consumer brand or a legacy manufacturer undergoing transformation, we help businesses achieve unprecedented levels of performance and customer experience.
Position Summary
We are seeking a DevOps Engineer to join our growing Digital Solutions team. This role supports both Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) and eCommerce-based environments for enterprise clients. You’ll be responsible for implementing CI/CD pipelines, automating infrastructure, and guiding clients and internal teams on industry best practices.
This role requires hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes, as you will be managing containerized applications across complex deployment environments. You should be comfortable working in fast-paced environments, leading technical conversations, and managing infrastructure for high-profile, complex digital solutions. Strong communication, systems thinking, and a deep passion for automation are essential.
Key Responsibilities
Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines and environment automation using tools like Jenkins, GitLab, Terraform, and Ansible.
Build and manage containerized applications using Docker and Kubernetes across development, staging, and production environments.
Configure and monitor environments for AEM and eCommerce platforms (PHP-based).
Guide clients in adopting best practices for infrastructure, deployment, and performance optimization.
Support distributed development teams with DevOps tooling and process improvements.
Lead infrastructure builds for high-availability production environments using AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Maintain web servers (Apache, NGINX), application runtimes (Java, PHP-FPM), and databases (MariaDB, Redis).
Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure and deployment issues.
Author and maintain clear documentation, including disaster recovery and infrastructure diagrams.
Evaluate internal systems for automation opportunities and implement improvements.
Participate in technical discussions and support client deployments, configuration, and monitoring.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent work experience.
3–5 years of DevOps engineering experience, preferably in digital or consulting environments.
Hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes in production environments.
Expertise in infrastructure automation tools: Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet.
Strong Linux/Unix systems administration experience.
Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, TeamCity, or Bamboo.
Scripting proficiency: Python, Bash, Shell, or Perl.
Experience with Adobe Experience Manager (v6.3+) and Dispatcher setup in production.
Familiarity with SDLC management systems, monitoring tools (Splunk, AppDynamics), and code quality frameworks.
Understanding of load-balanced and clustered infrastructure environments.
Preferred Skills
Experience supporting AEMaaCS, AMS, Adobe I/O, Brand Portal, or Adobe Marketing Cloud.
Exposure to PHP-based commerce platforms and frameworks.
Experience managing infrastructure supporting high-traffic e-commerce or content-driven websites.
Experience with Apache HTTPD configuration (vhosts, caching, SSL).
Familiarity with virtualization tools (VMware, Vagrant).
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced setting.
Active security clearance is a plus.
Travel Requirements
This position may require occasional travel upon request.
Full Time, Non-Temporary Employees enjoy a competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision insurance, life insurance, disability, paid time off, 401(k), and more! Additional perks vary by location.
Blue Acorn iCi is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, spouse of protected veteran, or disability.
Please click to read EEO Law and Pay Transparency Act and IER Right to Work Document and Privacy Notice.
Blue Acorn iCi will endeavor to make a reasonable accommodation to the known physical or mental limitations of a qualified applicant with a disability unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business. If you believe you require such assistance to complete this form or to participate in an interview, please contact us at: engagement@blueacornici.com.
California applicants: Please click here for CCPA disclosures.

title: DevOps Engineer
job_description:
At Submittable, we are transforming how organizations create social impact. Our platform empowers thousands of mission-driven organizations, from nonprofits to government entities, to make a difference in their communities and beyond. In 2024, our innovative software helped organizations worldwide run 30,000 programs, welcomed 1.2 million applicants, and facilitated the distribution of more than $10 billion in funding through our products on behalf of our clients.
We are on a mission to help organizations accelerate their impact, so we are proud to partner with organizations focused on Equity & Social Justice, Children & Education, Creative & Arts, Health & Wellness, Economic Justice & Opportunity, and Environment & Climate. At Submittable, technology and purpose converge, offering a unique opportunity to contribute to meaningful change.
We are dedicated to empowering people and organizations to discover, manage, and support their missions through our innovative software solutions. We are committed to growth, efficiency, and providing a world-class experience to our clients. At Submittable, we build software that enables our customers to drive positive change around the globe. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a growing, purpose-driven company that thrives at the intersection of philanthropy and technology.
As a member of our DevOps team, you will work closely with your peers and members of our development team to help refine development processes and infrastructure to bring the latest technologies and methodologies to our infrastructure and technical teams. Submittable products are high-availability, high-traffic SaaS applications requiring production support; our DevOps team is critical in responding to production issues, tackling complex problems, and helping drive our team's technological direction.
If you are ready for a new adventure at a growing tech company committed to helping our customers further the good they do in their communities and the world, we would love to hear from you. Our engineering offices are in Bellevue, WA, and Missoula, MT.
How You'll Make an Impact:
The DevOps Engineer will help refine our development processes and infrastructure to bring the latest technologies and methodologies to the team. This role is also responsible for providing production support and will respond to production issues that arise, tackle complex problems, and contribute to the team's technological direction. Success in this role is further defined by the ability to self-manage time and priorities to maximize output efficiently.
Help shape, maintain, and support large-scale distributed cloud infrastructure (AWS and Azure)
Optimize the automation and tools that enable teams to accelerate delivery
Perform infrastructure audits to identify risks, increase observability of logs, metrics, and tracing
Maintain continuous integration and deployment pipelines
Manage AWS costs
Provide on-call support for infrastructure-related issues
Maintain infrastructure documentation, assist with post-mortems and root cause analysis
Follow security best practices to ensure compliance with company policy
Improve the development experience
Skills & Experience We Hope You Bring:
2+ years as an engineer on a software development team
Strong understanding of Kubernetes (EKS, AKS, service mesh) and GitOps (Flux, ArgoCD)
Familiarity with observability tools such as DataDog and Prometheus/Grafana
Solid experience with networking, including TCP/IP, Akamai/CDN, DNS, Firewalls
Knowledge of Terraform and infrastructure-as-code practices
Prior experience working in cross-functional teams
Systems architecture and design skills
Solid experience with security and compliance best practices
Build and deployment automation experience
Proficiency with common ops tooling (containerization, VMs, Logstash + Kibana, etc)
Experience with AWS, GCP, or Azure
Comfort maintaining live production systems
Love of learning
Thrives in a highly collaborative environment and enjoys the change to pair with peers
Additional/Preferred Skills & Qualifications:
Ability to communicate well with others
Familiarity with client-side JavaScript frameworks (preferably AngularJS/Angular)
Developing, interfacing with, and integrating with REST APIs
Automated testing tools and techniques
Debugging tools and techniques
Knowing when, why, and how to refactor
AWS Certification(s) (SA, SysOps)
GitHub Actions or Jenkins
SOC 2 compliance
Salary Details: The annual salary range for this position is $105,000-$125,000. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. We also have a location-based compensation structure; there may be a different range for candidates in other locations.

We are interested in every qualified candidate eligible to work in the United States; however, we cannot accommodate scholastic or employment visas at this time.
Why Submittable?
Joining Submittable means becoming part of a forward-thinking, mission-driven company that values innovation, collaboration, and growth. We empower organizations working for social good with technology that accelerates their work, amplifies their impact, and drives meaningful change.
At Submittable, you'll find a supportive, dynamic work environment where your contributions directly influence our success. If you thrive in a fast-paced, evolving environment and are excited to be part of a company dedicated to social impact, we invite you to apply!
Benefits: We are proud to offer highly competitive benefits to our full-time employees, including:
Comprehensive health and life insurance with optional HSA, FSA, and DCA accounts
401(k) plan with employer match starting day one
Equity stock options to share in our success
Flexible hours, remote work options, and generous vacation and sick leave
Paid parental leave for mothers, fathers, and adoptive parents
Professional development stipends to support your career growth
Opportunities to participate in community outreach and volunteer programs
Monthly company-sponsored happy hours and gatherings to connect and unwind
Our Commitment to Inclusion & Belonging
At Submittable, we believe technology is a force for good, driving social impact and enabling corporate social responsibility on a global scale. To achieve this, we are committed to fostering a workplace that values inclusion and belonging as central pillars of our culture.
We embrace the strength of our diverse community by creating a safe space where employees feel empowered to share ideas, celebrate unique experiences, and learn from one another. By prioritizing inclusion, we aim to build an environment where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and make innovative contributions that enable our customers to tackle complex challenges and spread more good.
As a globally used platform, we are dedicated to hiring and supporting employees who represent a range of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. This includes diversity in ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, religion, ability, culture, and socioeconomic background.

title: DEVOPS ENGINEER
job_description:
DEVOPS ENGINEER

Palco is a visionary company pioneering an emerging health-care movement that empowers people with disabilities and those aging to live independent and quality lives. Made possible by our amazing team, Palco provides technology and financial services to aid individuals and their families to thrive in their home and communities. Partnered with government agencies and fortune 500 managed care organizations across the country, we are dedicated to creating exceptional outcomes for our clients and the millions of people that count on them. We are a highly organized company that offers flexible working hours, a solid work/life balance, autonomy, generous paid time off, bonus potential, and career advancement opportunities. Our staff make long-lasting impact on the lives of people every day.

We are seeking a skilled and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software development, system administration, and automation. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines to ensure scalability, reliability, and efficiency.

Responsibilities
Ensure cloud environments adhere to security and compliance standards.
Optimize infrastructure cost, scalability, and reliability across cloud platforms.
Collaborate with development and QA teams to streamline release cycles and support software delivery.
Architect, implement and maintain Terraform-based IaC modules for Azure, GCP and GitHub infrastructure.
Manage CI/CD pipelines, deployment workflows, and automation frameworks.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve infrastructure issues in production and non-production environments.
Participate in strategy and architectural discussions and contribute to technical decision-making.
Communicate, document, and advocate for DevOps best practices across Application Development and IT teams.
Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies to ensure solutions remain modern and effective.
Required Skills and Expertise
3+ years of hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform.

title: DevOps Engineer (REMOTE)
job_description:
Eagle Harbor Solutions, LLC, a Koniag Government Services company, is seeking a System Administrator with a Secret clearance to support EHS and our government customer. This is a Remote opportunity.

We offer competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, three weeks paid time off, and more.

The System Administrator will support AWS cloud-based migration and/or operations maintaining the client’s enterprise reporting application.

The ideal candidate is dedicated to strengthening and maintaining his/her skillset to match the need of the work environment. There is a potential for occasional face-to-face SAFe ceremonies on occasion. The client is located in Clarksburg, WV which Travel would be covered by the Client.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for the upkeep, configuration, and reliable operation of computer systems
Ensure the uptime, performance, resources, and security of the computers they manage meet the needs of the users
The systems administrator could be focused in one or more of the following areas:
A database administrator (DBA) maintains a database system and is responsible for the integrity of the data and the efficiency and performance of the system.
A network administrator maintains network infrastructure such as switches and routers, and diagnoses problems with these or with the behavior of network-attached computers.
A security administrator is a specialist in computer and network security, including the administration of security devices such as firewalls, as well as consulting on general security measures.
A web administrator maintains web server services that allow for internal or external access to web sites. Tasks include managing multiple sites, administering security, and configuring necessary components and software. Responsibilities may also include software change management.
A system programmer creates, modifies, and test the code, forms, and script that allow computer applications to run. They may also develop and write computer programs to store, locate, and retrieve specific documents, data, and information.
A computer operator performs routine maintenance and upkeep, such as changing backup tapes or replacing failed drives.
Requirements:
Secret clearance required.
Must have 1-year relevant experience w/ High School Degree or higher
Knowledge of one or more of these technologies is preferred: AWS, Linux, or Ansible
Security Requirements:
Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Secret clearance is required.
