title: Application and Web Information Technology Accessibility Specialist
job_description:
Koniag Management Solutions, a Koniag Government Services company, is seeking an Application and Web Information Technology Accessibility Specialist to support KMS and our government customer. This is a remote opportunity.

We offer competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, three weeks paid time off, and more.
Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:
Senior IT Accessibility Specialist that Specializes in Application and Web compliance:
The Senior IT Accessibility Specialist shall provide subject matter expertise regarding Section 508 program & policy support.
The Senior IT Accessibility Specialist will liaise with agency components to provide guidance for Section 508 compliance and Trusted Tester methodologies, draft and maintain Section 508 policy and process documentation, provide consultation services throughout the software development and procurement lifecycle to ensure delivery of Section 508 conformant software and hardware products, and validate reported Section 508 issues.
The Senior IT Accessibility Specialist also provides direction and guidance to IT Accessibility Specialists.
Minimum Experience (Specialize in Section 508 application testing):
Five years’ experience working in a department or agency Section 508 compliance/accessibility program office.
Two years of experience of Section 508 knowledge on creating policy and integrating new guidelines into an existing policy
Three years of experience in evaluating, documenting, reporting, and validating program applications, website, and other developed ICT for Section 508 compliances
Three years’ experience with the federal acquisition process and requirements and with Enterprise IT Lifecycle
Sensitivity Level: IT level I
Capable of evaluating web pages, web applications, and software for Section 508 compliance according to the DHS Trusted Tester 5.1 process.
Capable of creating Accessibility Conformance Reports (ACRs) and Remediation Plan templates based on Section 508 accessibility testing for each website or application tested.
Capable of managing and maintaining storage of all testing-related documentation, including ACRs and Remediation Plans.
Capable of meeting regularly with development team Project Managers or points of contact (POCs) to review Section 508 test results.
Capable of developing 508 compliant documents for the Section 508 Program Management
Capable of developing and delivering Virtual Instructor-Led Training (VILT) events on Section 508 web/application accessibility standards.
DHS Trusted Tester certified.
Familiar with web software development (i.e., PowerApps, HTML, CSS, and/or JavaScript)
Familiar with Section 508 document remediation (recommended)
Capable of remediating a one-page document of medium complexity for Section 508 in compliance with the latest WCAG standards within 15 minutes, without human assistance, using automated and manual testing (recommended)
Proficient with the agency currently approved versions of the following software:
Microsoft Windows 11
Microsoft 365 Office Suite
Adobe Acrobat
Freedom Scientific Fusion
Job Access With Speech (JAWS)
ZoomText
Allyant Commonlook Office/PDF Suite (recommended)
Colour Contrast Analyser (CCA)
SSA Accessible Name and Description Inspector (ANDI)
DHS Accessibility Conformance Reporting Tool (ACRT)
Must comply with all Section 508 Content Testing capability.
Our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy
The company is an equal opportunity employer. The company shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, creed, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), national origin or ancestry, age, disability, citizenship, military/veteran status, marital status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. We are committed to equal employment opportunity in all decisions related to employment, promotion, wages, benefits, and all other privileges, terms, and conditions of employment.

The company is dedicated to seeking all qualified applicants. If you require an accommodation to navigate or apply for a position on our website, please get in touch with Heaven Wood via e-mail at accommodations@koniag-gs.com or by calling 703-488-9377 to request accommodations.

Koniag Government Services (KGS) is an Alaska Native Owned corporation supporting the values and traditions of our native communities through an agile employee and corporate culture that delivers Enterprise Solutions, Professional Services and Operational Management to Federal Government Agencies. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Koniag, we apply our proven commercial solutions to a deep knowledge of Defense and Civilian missions to provide forward leaning technical, professional, and operational solutions. KGS enables successful mission outcomes for our customers through solution-oriented business partnerships and a commitment to exceptional service delivery. We ensure long-term success with a continuous improvement approach while balancing the collective interests of our customers, employees, and native communities. For more information, please visit www.koniag-gs.com.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. Shareholder Preference in accordance with Public Law 88-352

title: UX Designer
job_description:
Proficient in UX design principles with a strong online portfolio showcasing passed UX experience. (Required to supply online portfolio with application)
Primary Skill Required:
User Experience Designers will have a primary focus of user research (creating research plans, facilitating the research, and synthesize the findings) using the insights to propose recommendations and design solutions (wireframing and low-fidelity designs) for intuitive new/improved user experiences.
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
3+ years hands-on experience as UX Designer, preferably as a member of UX team(s)
2+ years hands-on experience in UX design, UX research or UX interaction design
Must have the ability to lead creation of user personas, experience maps, and information architecture
Familiarity with digital design and understanding digital analytics
Uses the UX design process to approach solving digital design challenges
Experienced with creating and conducting moderated and unmoderated usability studies
Experienced with common design software (Figma, Axure, Adobe products, Keynote/PPT for the creation of IXD artifacts, documentation, and presentations -or- fluency with Photoshop and Illustrator
Ability to design for and execute across multiple interfaces, platforms and channels (Web, email, mobile, social media)
Fluent in responsive design
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Ability to communicate ideas through effective storytelling with sketches, wireframes, comps and prototypes
Familiarity with Google Analytics or other Web analytics solutions (Google Analytics, Optimizely, Contentsquare)
Familiarity with ADA compliance requirements
Understanding of branding as it relates to user experience
Strong communication and presentation skills
Humility and recognition that you don't have all the answers
Adaptability and an enthusiasm for continuous learning
Creativity, imagination and a sense of humor
Places high value on the diverse strengths, backgrounds, and talents others bring to the workforce.

PREFERRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Bachelor's degree in design or related field
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience designing for mobile platforms (iOS and Android)
Interest and participation in professional industry groups, conferences

User Experience Designers:
Advocate for users across the organization and communicate the value and principles of user-centered design
Iterate on ideas based upon validated learning, critique, and collaboration
Create personas, user flows, empathy maps, journey maps, experience maps, information architecture and other documents to document and communicate research findings
Design task analysis, user flows and stories, navigation, content hierarchies, interaction design, and functioning prototypes
Establish and evolve designs to meet user needs under various scenarios (browser, screen size, screen readers, etc.)
Understand digital accessibility and design using best practices for ADA compliance to ensure that designs and code provide progressive enhancements and accessibility for all users
Engage in project strategy planning
Effectively manage their workflow to meet expectations and deadlines
Collaborate with Developers to solve UX issues with layout and functionality-based solutions
Work closely with Stakeholders, Project Managers, Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Business Analyst, Architects, UX
Researchers, UX Visual Designers and Developers documenting detailed design requirements
Iterate on designs based on user feedback results
Build interactive prototypes for usability studies
Participate in key meetings including daily stand-ups and planning sessions
Inform the design process of opportunities and challenges presented by the medium through which the user will experience the product
Stay current with UX, tools and technology
Champion the UX approach in other departments


Services Description:
As a key member of our Digital Experience & Design team, the User Experience (UX) Designers are responsible for user-centered design, visualizing, and executing strategic user experiences in our digital products. This role excels as a passionate designer, collaborator, customer advocate, and continuous learner. Focused on creating delightful experiences that match user/customer needs with business goals, while reinforcing the Company's brand image. And, will work closely with a team of designers, developers, and content strategists, as well as technology and business partners throughout the UX design process.

Deliverables Description (if applicable):
The UX Designer will design, facilitate, and analyze various user research activities, including user testing, interviews, and observations, while leveraging user research insights and business strategy requirements to create innovate interactive web/mobile/tablet application concepts, and drive them to completion. They will be captivated by understanding and serving as a champion for the user/customer in every discussion and at every decision point.
